LbE5rlNhEG1y0swPKnvTbg.review_text: Bad part. Parking. It is really crappy parking. Place gets crowded. But Im sure it cant be for the food. Mussels tasted like armpits. Dont ask me how I know what armpit taste like. Sardines decent. Gnocchi ok. Hipster chic but nothing special.

rjNtTdAhbe4GpgGebnbHIQ.review_text: I've visited Maven so many times that I've finally felt compelled to write a review.   Every time I've been here I've received excellent service and outstanding recommendations.  The duck sliders are my all time favorite! And the seasonal dishes are outstanding! The drinks are great and I always walk out with a great buzz and a taste for more! Amberly has been my server more than once and Kate, the bartender, always shows extreme composure every time I come to visit. The management has been kind and giving. I can't wait to have one of their cocktails again! Or try one of Chef Isaac's wonderful creations

HSoJDMeGby4MieGdSGrFEQ.review_text: Luckily, I came here when there was no wait(!!).  I had the billionaire's bacon as a side.  Although, it doesn't make you feel like a billionaire, it does taste pretty damn good. It is similar to the millionaire's bacon from Kitchen Story, but you get three pieces since it is sliced about half as thick.  Definitely worth the $5.  My main course was the duck hash. It came with a duck egg served sunny side up and breakfast potatoes. The hash was excellent, and the egg was cooked perfectly. The potatoes lacked flavor when eaten after the bacon or duck, however. Overall an excellent meal, as I left with an empty plate.  Staff was very polite and attentive. I wish they offered to go cups, since I ordered the large Blue Bottle Coffee not knowing how large it actually was...

-_Gll6sDvlazPkoGr6ojCQ.review_text: A newer, trendier spot in Lower Haight.  They boast a cool atmosphere, I especially love the cozy couches upstairs.  They serve great cocktails and very seasonal food with a cool menu layout comprised for pairing food, wine and spirits.  Great service, great job!  Check it out!

Rx7DNBmPPShVjlcQidGuTw.review_text: i came here around 7 pm on fri night and luckily snagged some seats at the communal table.  seating is first come, first serve, and by the time my friends showed up, there was a wait for tables.   cocktails here are tasty, as is the food, which are all share plates.  we tried the dungeness crab w/ avocado, the duck sliders, fries, tomato salad w/ burrata, the calamari, and the lemon chiffon cake.  the crab and duck sliders were my faves.  the decor here is really nice and totally unassuming from the outside.  i particularly like the long communal tables, b/c you could easily chat up your neighbors and see what they're eating.

AgzHzIzC6ZHTKgker0egAg.review_text: Disclaimer: RNM was my "go to" spot when I lived in the Lower Haight.  Using my insane powers of deduction, I can only hypothesize that my leaving the neighborhood took away from RNM's bottom line to the point where they had to close their doors.  Oops, my bad.  So anyways, I recently made my way back into the Lower Haight and into Maven for the first time.    It was weird at first.    Kind of like going back to visit your childhood home now that someone else lives there.  Layout is the same, but shit is definitely different.    Bottom line...Maven is a great replacement for RNM.  I think these guys at Maven are on to something.    Given the fact that anyone under the age of 35 has a phone in their face at all times with a crippling case of ADD, i think the way we go out is changing.  Gone are the days of a long dinner and movie.    Here are the days of number of quick visits that include food, drinks, and hopefully, if you're lucky, some sort of medicinal therapy at some point of the evening.    Maven is cool as you're sharing communal tables and the menu layout is somewhat inspired by tapas style sizing and drink pairings.    I am a huge fan of variety and if you start your evening at Maven, you'll be setting yourself up well for the remainder of the night.    Huge fan of the "bites" on the back page as well so don't overlook those.  And now, to only add to my delight, they now offer brunch.    Go, be cool, ignore the "accidentally on purposely dressed hipster" moron in the corner and down some seriously good edibles and libations.    Attention.

pxXj0O3rAhNz5sFTobWipA.review_text: This place is awsome! Interesting beer, tasty food (also very creating), great service. The place is very cosy. I am sad I live on the other coast, otherwise I would be there at least one a week.

QOiZu9pn65H7zR49_DdVdQ.review_text: Grubbed the Bar Menu Last week:  Warm Olives were super nice. Ultra buttery. Best dish.  Charcuterie plate was tasty, if a bit skimpy on the meats.  Duck Sliders and french fries, both acceptable.  I'll come back for a burger and brew.

41Z70MtOy9ZyhVtnLemJ_w.review_text: Great drinks! Delicious.   Food is good. Found the duck sliders to be good except for the bread used which I think should be better cut. Too much bread at top.  The fries were salted a bit too much.  Loved the vibe inside. Was walking up haight looking for a good cocktail, small plates, and good ambiance. Maven's got just that. First time there and so happy to find such a place in my hood!  Will go again.

LAXM51xp6ig4NfrB22eNKQ.review_text: Came here for dinner - cocktail game on point, food delicious. Can't wait to try brunch!  to try: trout was a standout to drink: hometown vixen  outdoor seating score: 0 but the balcony seating is fun!

hrWnftKtSg5kOlMkMUW0cQ.review_text: Upstairs couches and tables or downstairs long shared tables. Came here with 4 people and tried A LOT of the menu. highlights: perfectly cooked beef brisket, the gnocchi were succulent (how could one possibly describe pasta this way?!), and the Unti Zinfandel was well priced. great service too!

y_jl-bErj1mnb4KF04F74Q.review_text: Great service, vibe, decor and cocktails. Creative pairing suggestions with cocktails, wine and food. Food not so exciting.

eMx5luVGcu_HvbODBFJ8Mg.review_text: Ok OK! I'm back adding a star because I finally had the burger.... And it was amazing! Recently also had the burger at NOPA (what is it with me a burgers lately?) and Maven's topped theirs by a long shot.   And have recently sat at the bar a couple of times and the bartender was awesome.  Maybe I can come back to add another star someday.

w9CsKtIEQWZrcQQsbfXIEA.review_text: A good place to meet up with friends for some drinks and light eats. The drink menu was pretty good. A little loud for conversation on a Saturday evening.

npuZyLlx1a9_0aErfr0FAA.review_text: First time at Maven and came away really impressed. Let's start off with the elegant industrial design. The restaurant was elegant, well-conceived, without being cold. The bar is clean and the garden above provides a fresh contrast.   My family and I went for Sunday brunch and each dish was better than the last! Plating and presentation was top notch and the food was very flavorful.   Highly recommended!!

ibvDovkjd6y86Zwua9Rp6g.review_text: I love this place. Not only does it make yummy cocktails, but the food pairings are exceptional and quite tasty. The decor is pleasant and open with a great corner location offering lots of light and window seating.  The crowd is lower haight, so there are always interesting people to meet at the bar.

Valva2MGzBW8ux3641YINA.review_text: I came on a Monday night and the place was only open downstairs, didn't get to check out the upstairs area. I like their live wall at the bar, cool. I hate the stools, my back was in pain after sitting there for a few hours, yes we were drinking the night away and stayed a while. The place wasn't packed at all but there was a good amount of people there. Now to the food, we ordered 3 things for 2 of us to share: Rocky's Chicken, Salmon crudo, chinatown duck sliders. The best thing I ate was the Chicken, I loved the nuts in it the chicken was cooked perfectly delicious! The salmon crudo was good but expensive for what it was. Duck Sliders were good, but I wish it wasn't shredded duck. This place is pricey, good treat.

42KLEHDWDDr0-zajOq6bbA.review_text: Really good food, excellent service and OK cocktails and beers. We tried the burger and the trout which were both very tasty. We did however find it overpriced for what we got, but I still recommend you pop in at least once and make your own mind up.

j1VUe41XObdkrbsYmZUctA.review_text: Really nice ambience at Maven and the drinks are good.  Wasn't a huge fan of the albacore, it was tiny.  The calamari was pretty good, as well as the sliders.  We were hungry after the small plates so we ended up getting the maven burger to share, which was my favorite out of what we tried!   I'm glad I got it.  They can do without the chips though.

-1pSQDWlS3HUU__Xt5Veow.review_text: Fantastic bar service, and great tapas. Had a long table for a bachlorette party dinner and the service was spot-on as well - attentive without being disruptive, just the way we all like it.  A bit pricey given the amount of food you get, but that's pretty par for the course in the area. The food was surprisingly good (I never have super high expectations for tapas places), and the burger was amazing.  We didn't think we'd get full but ended up having to roll ourselves out of there.

RUDYZSMCToAiVCWEMVLP7Q.review_text: Cool place w/ good cocktails and amazing duck sliders. Glad we tried it out.

_pfG3f9iTnjnjDtntq4jtg.review_text: Perfect Sunday spot.  We had yummy cocktails to start (suggest the Mr. Wiggles) and lovely glass of Pinot with dinner.  Highly recommend the warm olives, scallop crudo to start,  asparagus and char for the main.  Everything tasted super fresh and was prepared just right.  Mmm, this one is a keeper.

l90pVaTZkXtAZvZauLqj4A.review_text: Great date spot, which is hard to find in Lower Haight. Fun drinks, good food. Most portions are small but perfect if you share a few things. The fireplace upstairs is the best, and the chairs are super comfortable and never too crowded.

gRtIqKlpP_YNp45x-MmeQQ.review_text: I came here for my birthday dinner with two of my closest friends and had a wonderful experience. Downstairs there is bar seating as well as large communal tables. Luckily we were able have a small table to ourselves upstairs which also has a cute sofa/lounge area. I loved the ambience- casual bar vibe but chic at the same time. Our server was very attentive for our multitude of continuous orders.  The cocktail menu is great with a creative and extensive variety. We tried maybe 5 or so different ones (including the 'International Mistress,' 'Corpse Reviver #598,' and 'Two Birds & a Stone'),  and loved them all.   There small plates were excellent. The Kennebec Fries were a good way to start off the meal. The Summer Squash was light and came with fresh salmon crudo. The Duck Sliders, Potato Gnocchi, and Brisket were all well-executed and delicious.  The dessert selection is more limited but we had both of them, the Coconut Panna Cotta, and the Fudgesicle Sundae, which were both yummy.   Awesome night!

M6vv_thbXnji_EF_Gq1P2Q.review_text: I thought I would be detoxing after all my New Years celebrations...but Maven's cocktails surely ended that thought quickly!  I can't recall ever having a drink as good as Beretta until my lips tasted those at Maven. (But that makes sense bc one of the owner's here is one of its decedents!) So, hip hip hooray for another option for delicious, super well-crafted, strong cocktails. They use top shelf stuff here, and the flavors just mend together beautifully. None too sweet, but dangerously delicious!  My fav's thus far: Nauti Mermaid and Santa's Cookies :).   Favorite nosh's: The Maven Burger, Fries, Calamari 2-ways, and the grilled Fennel with Burrata. I'm gonna have to put it out there now and say that the Maven Burger DEFINITELY tops the infamous Marlowe Burger. It's super juicy and perfectly seasoned.   The decor is modern and slick, and the ambiance is hip and trendy. Totally unexpected for the area, but well appreciated! (It's kitty corner from Toronado's/Rosemunde Sausages). Oh, and the service is super nice and attentive.   All in all, I'd definitely be back for the excellent cocktails and that burger!  TIP: The cocktails and food  listed adjacent to each other on the menu are intended to pair with each other. GENIUS!

JG2-Z87cVoVQRiCaTtc7jw.review_text: I had dinner at Maven with my lady and 2 friends. We went around 6:45pm on a rainy Sunday. We waited for about 10 minutes for room at a common table. We took the time to study the menu. Cocktails looked amazing. Food looked good. Decent beers on draft. Prices were a bit high but it's a classy place, and we watched the bartender light rosemary on fire to get its essence into a drink, so it's obvious they work hard for the money. Being a design snob, I remarked that the organization of the menu was a little bit weird: Three columns, one each for Cocktails, Plates and Pulls, where pulls means draft beer. I found it hard to follow.   Once we sat down, the server informed us that the menu was intentionally organized around its cocktails. Where some restaurants will suggest pairing for their food, Maven goes the opposite route, and recommends food and follow up drinks to go along with their artisnal cocktails.   And, oh, the cocktails were amazing. I personally had the Corpse Reviver #598 and the Maven BullDog. Others at the table had the Hires' Hand, Fireside Cocktail, the 5 Spot, and the Hometown Vixen. And oh my, were they all delicious. My group is a familiar bunch so we all shared some appetizers: brussel sprouts, house pickled vegetables, and even the oysters. All delicious. I actually like my oysters a little more brine-y than they were, but hey, at least you know they clean them judiciously. Not a piece of shell or sand accompanied my slurps. So good. And nice and big!   I think it was at the transition from apps to dinner where Maven stumbled in my eyes. My personal dinner was quite good, and filling (I had the mussels). Unfortunately, the rest of my group wasn't 100% by the amount of food vs. price they were paying. I know, I know, classy joints serve you proper serving sizes, but... it still felt a bit off.   Maven made up for it with dessert (we all split 2 orders of the Fudgcicle pie). Very delicious, particularly when paired when the Maven Bulldog (which was really just an alcoholic dessert).   All in all a good night out. However, I would recommend that you don't do a full dinner at Maven--instead, go there for appetizers or for dessert. It's really not a dinner place at heart.

-OODneV01sxed0jBUv8XVg.review_text: Whats the hype all about?  This place was OK...  The decor is nice, the staff are friendly and the Winter Rye was DELISH!  FOOD??? Theres hardly anything on the menu.  Fries and Oysters ( two rounds please) Fries with olive aioli was yummy and the Kumomoto Oysters were also very tasty.  Other than that I dont have much to say about this place.  The upstairs is really too small to hang out and chill.    I guess if I was in the area, I would stop by again.

AVyP2ywHnG4m5gh-xHl3_A.review_text: Beautiful, super chic bar with great food and cocktails. It doesn't get better than this.   First of all, I recommend sitting at the kitchen bar so that you can see your food prepared before your eyes. I barely touch anything in my own kitchen at home but somehow watching the chefs work their stations with such expertise and precision was a magical and enchanting sight to behold.  As for food itself, it's like booshy comfort food with high quality ingredients. I would definitely get the Penn Cove Mussels again. They came with Korean chili pepper, absinthe, and grilled bread. Comes with tons of steamy, delectable mussels which are wonderfully prepared and not bad for the price. For the entree, my friend and I shared the Maven Burger which came with angostura, house pickles, and muenster cheese. You have to order fries on the side but they're totally worth it. The burger was juicy with great flavor.   In addition to all of that, we downed some killer cocktails. I can't even remember which ones they were, just that each sip was like a burst of unique spicy and tangy or sweet and fruity flavors.   Everyone should try this place at least once!!

VbCk66wii5YtGUic6z3GWA.review_text: This place is just a fancy bar. The food on the menu sounds interesting, but the execution is so uneven that 2 out of 3 of our orders were inedible. The hamburger was raw in the middle and the calamari may have been fresh a few days before, but when I got it, had a very strong taste of decay. First time ever I've had to send back calamari -- one of my perennial favorites.   What's worse, when we told them about it, they just thanked us for our input, whisked off the bad food and then billed us for it anyway. We usually give new restaurants in the neighborhood a second try if they miss the first time. I don't think we can trust this one again.  The decor of this place is in much better taste than the previous occupant's, RNM, but RNM's food was far, far better. I never had a bad plate there.

HCtEYgABFgwGhHB3rPQeQQ.review_text: Service couldn't have been better.  Upscale and small intimate place.  Duck sliders were so good!!!!!  Just had a couple glasses of wine and a couple appetizers, but can't wait to come back starving so I can try everything!!!  Beautiful space.  Really loved it!

IuU1TM_rTx2Z_UCn7qR6kw.review_text: Went to Maven on a whim - well because of a whim of a bloomspot group deal (4 course tasting with cocktail pairings) - and we were blown away. We have eaten at several San Fran restaurants with similar "new" style American food but Maven is now our favorite. If you get anything you must try the Albacore. It was perfectly cooked and had a gorgeous texture.

drI9J9xeWephVGlfMC487w.review_text: I've had Maven on my radar for a while now. The lucky convergence of a special deal from Bloomspot, a nice review from Michael Bauer, and a desire to take a friend who is moving away out to dinner made a visit a reality. The Bloomspot deal was for a four course chef's tasting-menu with cocktail pairings. The exact menu turned out to be: Summer Squash Tortellini  (fresh pasta with tomato confit, our ricotta, and summer beans) paired with the Improved Whisper Cocktail (10yr cognac, lillet, orgeat, lemon, chili, and smoke) Chinatown Duck Sliders (pulled duck meat with shiitake mushroom, chinese greens, and bacon) paired with a 5 Spot (aged rhum, ginger, lime, maple, thai basil, and five spice)  Local Albacore (served with an eggplant puree, smoked creme fraíche, and togarashi) paired with an Ume Goodness (Hibiki 12yr, sherry, cocchi, plum shrub)  Mayan Chocolate No2 (a dark chocolate cake with orgeat ice cream, hazelnut, vanilla, bitter orange) paired with the Beach and Hyde (bourbon, coffee, vanilla, egg white, and orange)  The standouts for me were the sliders and the tuna. The sliders were juicy and perfectly seasoned. The Asian flavors were reflected in the subtle yet compelling 5 spot. Something about the combination of lime and Thai basil always makes me smile. Add in the maple, rhum and five spice and you have a winning cocktail. The tuna was a sweetly complex dish with multiple layers of flavor, color, and texture. It was a perfectly-sized portion, served rare, just the way I like it. The togarashi brought out all the sweet/sour notes from the plum shrub in the Ume Goodness, which was my favorite cocktail.  I like the concept, and would be interested in going again and trying some of the same things with the suggested wine pairings.  Maven is bright and cheerful, with lots of greenery above the bar, light walls, dark wood seating, and fun overhead lighting.There are several seating options, which include large communal tables, the bar, and facing the kitchen. My friend and I took the opportunity to sit at the bar that faces the kitchen. Not only did we get to see everything as it was being prepared, we got to ask questions. I don't know if that would work when Maven is really busy, but it was definitely a nice option for an early evening meal. Both the chef and our server were cute (and efficient), neither of which ever hurts.  While we were sitting in front of the grill, we saw at least a dozen burgers go out, if not more. They looked like little works of art and I'm super curious. I think on my next visit that's what I'll go for. It also seemed to be the most substantial thing on the menu.

sPqHcRC--tRanPC-g4pNwQ.review_text: I'm glad I came to Maven with a food maven, because the dishes here deserve the highest appreciation and praise. Harmonious flavor combinations using fresh ingredients, beautifully presented in perfect portions, PLUS pairings with select cocktails and beers/wines. This restaurant will inspire the budding food maven in you. We shared 3 plates, which range from small appetizers to full entrees to desserts, and 2 cocktails. $12 MONTEREY SARDINES with beets, frisee, shaved celery, thyme vinaigrette (yelp.com/biz_photos/mave…). The sardines were fresh and flavorful, but I should mention that the only sardines I recall eating in the past have been from cans. So this was inevitably a step up heh. Loved the red and white stewed beets in this dish, but I would pass on this dish for something else on the menu. (GET THE) $10 CHINATOWN DUCK SLIDERS composed of seasoned duck meat, boy choy, hoisin sauce, and a whole shiitake mushroom on a petite sesame brioche bun (yelp.com/biz_photos/mave…). I'm always taken aback by how small sliders are aha. I enjoyed the Asian twist on the typical slider, especially given how moist and juicy the pulled duck was. The bok choy didn't really shine through (though one wouldn't expect it too), and you could definitely taste the shiitake mushroom in certain bites. The pulled duck meat is lean and fairly devoid of fat, which may underwhelm those who prefer duck truer to the crispier and fattier Asian style. And the brioche bun is ridic soft, like baby-butt-putty soft. I should have asked where they get their buns from, dangit (update: Pinkie's Bakery in SoMa!). That would also be a poor pick-up line haha :P (GET THE) $23 MCFARLAND SPRINGS RAINBOW TROUT with saffron, twice-cooked potatoes, melted leeks, spanish chorizo (yelp.com/biz_photos/mave…). There are so many different ingredients, all which contribute to how amazing this dish is. As the food maven was explaining to me, Spanish Chorizo (cured and dried) is very different from Mexican chorizo (raw before being cooked), and the curing makes the chorizo resemble salami in appearance but not taste. The twice-cooked potatoes are first boiled and then fried, and they are bomb. I enjoyed dipping them in the dollops of super-subtly-sweet saffron gel on the plate. Even better are the melted leeks--the butter that they stew the leeks in has crack in it. I'm positive. Last but not least, the crazily moist trout with its addictive crispy skin exceeds expectations. I still mistake it for salmon, dangit. $11 5 SPOT made with aged rhum, ginger, citrus, maple, thai basil, five spice, was good but sharp on the tongue. The spices cannot be ignored. (GET THE) $12 CAN CAN made with 10yr cognac, cardamom, blood orange, citrus went down so smooth. Perfect for sipping with your meal. As for layout, Maven is fairly spacious with bar seating, communal tables on the first floor, and more intimate table seating on the mezzanine. We got there around 7:20 PM and were seated immediately, but the place was definitely close to capacity. Past 7:45 PM, there was a consistent line milling around the entrance. The service here is exceptional--the waitstaff are prompt, earnest, and efficient. But srsly. Whether or not you're actually a "foodie," as long you can appreciate well-executed slow food (and if you can eat food slowly, because you absolutely CANNOT devour/scarf/inhale the dishes here, it would be a crime, and an expensive one at that), you need to pay a visit to Maven.

r-8eQ28RhnQPJdZXHcTXrw.review_text: Friend wanted to get dinner. We exchanged bookmarks and found the common link was Maven, so our party of five were booked for a Monday night in June.  Let's go right to the good stuff - absolute standouts were kanpachi crudo and duck sliders. I would also order the crab again. All else were dispensable: burrata (Delarosa does a stellar version), fries with olive aioli (if fries are a must...otherwise, skip), and charcuterie.  I ordered the 5 Spot: aged rum, ginger, lime, maple, Thai basil, and a house-made five spice blend. Drinks at our table were well made, though no standouts after we swap-sampled.   Beautiful space reminiscent of Nopa. 'Hood looks a bit sketch. Parking was easy in the sense that I saw four cars leave within a five-minute timeframe. Parking was hard in the sense that I couldn't get to them before everyone else. Bastards.  Just not my parking day...  All in all, I wouldn't hesitate to come back, as long as I know which items to skip on.

oiUXOh9KJ0vfblSv__bT0Q.review_text: A great new addition to Lower Haight.  We had several shared dishes and loved everything.  The chef came by the table to make sure we were happy.  The interior is very cool and the community tables set the atmosphere of a causal and friendly dining experience.    We'll be back.

U7ykMsZbSv1heetIuFgONw.review_text: I went here last night and I will definitely go back! We sat by the kitchen and watched the chefs which was kinda fun.  Drinks - Global warming and Whisper Whiskey (?) were my favorites Food - Crispy calamari was amazing both flavor and texture was perfect, which can be a challenge for calamari. Duck sliders were delicious, as was the kampachi.  Dessert - Lemon chiffon cake, the cake was so-so, the flavors of the yuzu ice cream and rhubarb compote, however were delicious.  Overall good experience, and I loved the simple short menu.

shBiw7nmWhwqxnCeqMwMKQ.review_text: This place is outstanding!  I have made three visits here and every one was impeccable!  The food is great, the drinks outstanding.  If the bartender doesn't think a drink is perfect, they remix it. and never send out a drink that is not prefect.  It keeps everything at an unusual high level of perfection.  The staff is really well educated on the specifics of the food prep and the nuances of the drinks.  It is a special place run by an amazing staff and I wish I could go here every night!!  Sit at one of Dan's tables.  You will be even more impressed.  Every menu item (drinks and food) are very reasonably priced.  Go early on weekends, it gets crazy around 6:30.

HovbiHYBCoQ2X-FUXC4Ysg.review_text: I tried this place for the first time on Friday. We were a hungry group of 7 who enjoyed our wait and drinks at the bar. In fact, I would go here again just for drinks... The food on the other hand....   As I said before, we were all very hungry. A few of us ordered the pork belly ($25.00!!) I was one of them. The presentation was nice but the portion was incredibly small. It came with three pieces of meat that were cut the same size and presented the same way as a steak tartare appetizer. We were all starving by the end of our meal and my friend who got one of the plates with I believe crab or fish, and seaweed hated the food and only had a few bites. Needless to say, in a rush at that point to get the night started, we ended up going over to church and market to Sparkys (desperate!) for a quick grilled cheese and french fries.  Overall, the food did not live up to my expectations, the price was outrageous for having to leave hungry. The bar was nice.

xnnk45c14oVOsBB7hn_r3w.review_text: Duck sliders and the sweet corn soup were delicious, as were the cocktails ('5 Spot').

iUacklAFmFbic1fnhkf8_g.review_text: Great ambiance, nice choice of appetizers and wines by the glass, friendly staff. A very welcome high end addition to this neighborhood

RdFLWtGebIBbW1DN4BtFqQ.review_text: Maven is a gem in the Haight! The food is incredible and the bartenders make personally crafted cocktails. I had dinner and drinks at the bar with a friend on a Friday night. It was uncharacteristically quiet that night due to the 4th of July holiday weekend. The bartenders have a down to earth style and personable but their cocktails are all series business with crafted cocktails from the menu, or personalized to your specific tastes. My friends tends toward the savory fair, while I like a citrus and bright. The bartenders were able to match our different drink tastes to the shared food courses. The menu was small, but complete. I can't be sure it was just the bar menu, or the same for the restaurant. I had the small plates salad and duck sliders. The meat was perfect - easy on the sauce which I prefer with the balance of crunch from the greens. The salad was simple and tasty. My friend had the burger, which he enjoyed.

xJl9yPNC3gumvTOcNNg-bA.review_text: What a let down!  The food was beautifully presented, but the seasoning was all over the place.  The crudo lacked any sort of flavor whatsoever, but the side of fries we ordered were so salty it burned our tongues!  The calamari came out limp and flavor-less, and the brussel sprouts were almost black.    However the duck sliders and pickles bumped this place up from being a complete disappointment in my book.

oo0gy7nuHywgAgpxETiB-g.review_text: The best parts of this restaurant are the atmosphere, the duck sliders and the cocktails.  Mr. Wiggles!  Ok I left one out the Kennebec fries with aioli.  The perfect dinner here would be the Chinatown duck sliders, the fries and either a 5 spot cocktail or the Mr. Wiggles.  The olives were ok and the goat cheese with radishes was pretty, but needed some sort of cracker to make the dish more interesting.  I just felt like I was scooping up radish and goat cheese (and flowers) with my fork and shoveling it in, poof it was gone.    Service was good and the restaurant had a lively vibe.  I would come back for combo I named earlier.

tkfPRd1LNWZY9VeH4oflXQ.review_text: Maven is a quality spot. Let me start by saying that there was nothing average about this restaurant; it just underwhelmed the lofty expectations that were laid out to me by the high praise of others. The servers were knowledgeable, the food was comfort oriented tapas and great for sharing, (I recommend the stuffed olives, and calamari), the artisianal drink selection had many high octane cocktails to explore,(I recommend their version of the Manhattan which had a nice bitter in place of a sweet aftertaste), and the ambiance was sleek with a cool hanging garden above the bar. All of these positives being said, this joint does not live up to the hype. The food portions are small, the shared counter top style seating on stools does not lend itself to intimacy or comfort, and the price tag was not commensurate with the quality.

6QN6BdpcDKXNS9Xq_7pECQ.review_text: review is only for the bar, did not eat here. kate the bartender and her co workers behind the bar were spot on. refilled our glasses of water without even asking while we were boozing it up.  tip top service.

8ygOqCWjvm_6X1Uf3reIXw.review_text: I will always come back if only for the cocktails, let alone the excellent food!

o6Dyk-73MhSG3RPM4rLrhw.review_text: Superb drinks. Great agnolotti. Burger was ok.

hzNovOr1t9_PZalpDjeelg.review_text: This is a good spot on Haight for happy hour.  Lots of communal style tables on the main level with a terrace above.  Friendly servers, and the olive aioli that comes with Kennebec Fries is verrrrrry tasty.

SdEFHl6uGFOTtOxtxi3h9Q.review_text: Cool atmosphere and nice staff. The drinks were fantastic but the food was only so-so. The burger is really small and was a bit overcooked.  It cost more than I think it holds it's weight in value - as there are a lot of places one can get a "gourmet" burger on this street.

n9NEd4wwuMs72gffl21AOg.review_text: In SF for a long weekend and had decided in advance that I was going to check this place out; glad I did! Why aren't there more cool, trendy places like this in SF?? Catch up to the rest of the world, people!  The interior is really freaking cool. It's got a distinctly modern vibe, but a living garden that's perched behind the bar ensures that Maven still exudes a sense of warmth. Two levels. Communal seating throughout. A Fireplace upstairs. Love, love, love the interior. A living garden at a bar...who'd a thunk it?  We came for drinks but had a few nibbles on the side. I stayed away from the cocktails list and opted for an Old Fashioned instead. The rest of my party imbibed with both wine and cocktails. They all liked their drinks. I was exceedingly pleased to see them use a single oversize ice cube in my drink, BUT what is up with using tap water for your ice cubes? Don't you know that it gives the ice a clouded look? If you're going to go with the single cube, you've got to use filtered or bottled water so that it's clear; come on, you can do better than that!  Also, this is now the second bar this weekend that couldn't make me a Cosmo because they didn't have cranberry juice. Seriously, how is it even possible to have a bar that can't make a Cosmo. It's not like it's the most exotic of drinks that I'm asking for.  I'm a little perplexed by some of the other comments which seem to focus on the price of the drinks. Forget the fact that there are menus posted outside the restaurant for a moment. Do you people not get out much? $10 - $15 is pretty standard cocktail pricing nowadays. Live a little.   Given that there's not a whole lot else going on in this neighborhood and that you can only spend so much time in one place, I'm not sure I would go out of my way to come here. But it would make for a great date spot before jumping off to an evening's main event.  You can trust me on this one; I'm an Elite. ;)

Rl-6DoFWV-kJBiaRIr4U2Q.review_text: This place is average.. The drinks are great however the food menu is slender.. Duck sliders are good as well as the brussell sprouts.. It took us 15-20 min to get anyone to help us and then another 20 min to get a seat.

8GnM32mXZTB-tBfxYp3U3w.review_text: Amazing cocktails food pairing.  We pretty much ordered all of the items on the pairing menu, my favorites are: duck sliders, pulled pork, potato gnocchi, the trouts... all are to die for.  And the cocktail that's good for everything: Corpse Reviver.

gji92ao5NAIrb3akKyqTZQ.review_text: I came here on a Sunday evening at around 7. The food was decent, drinks were great and the wait staff was attentive and friendly. The decor is comfortable and sleek, and the crowd was casual and mellow. I'll definitely go back, and am excited to try the brunch menu.  ---update-- went for the second time last week and the service continues to be stellar, it's roomy and relaxed. You must try the olives and cheese plate!!

NQWjRBwXGdeG2uWDIZLPQA.review_text: I ate brunch here with on Sunday with a friend from out-of-town and my husband. Waitstaff was friendly and attentive, ambiance was welcoming and comfortable.   We ordered the bread pudding, the German souffle pancake, the billionaires bacon and drinks. Food came out quickly and tasted great.   Unfortunately, I found a small piece of plastic in my souffle. Having worked in professional kitchens, I can overlook a-lot because I am all too aware of how easily mistakes like that can happen. I set it aside and kept eating. A few bites later, I found two more pieces and decided it was time to say something. The server was apologetic and even the chef came out to apologize. He was very nice.They brought me another souffle, which is all I really wanted. However, the chef was kind enough to also bring a scone and coffee cake for our trouble, we did not request anything extra or expect it.  We finished eating and were brought the check. I noticed that they kindly removed my souffle from the tab but was disappointed to see that they charged me for the scone and coffee cake. We did not order those items, the chef gave them to us himself. Not wanting to make a further fuss, I simply paid the bill and left. I was disappointed.  I would give this place another try just because the food was delicious and that is enough to bring me back.

mtYEVjHAPohZKu0EKS_A4A.review_text: Disclaimer: This is a BRUNCH review!  Completely blown away by Maven's brunch. Showed up at 10:50am to no wait, and were the first ones seated at 11am. The atmosphere is trendy with long communal tables and a beautiful bar with a creative vignette of greenery over it.   The food was fantastic. The huevos rancheros benedict was so creative with perfectly poached eggs and a delicious amalgam of sauces. The bread pudding french toast was equally as delicious.  Top it off with a Blue Bottle french press and a friendly and attentive wait staff and I'm a happy camper. Will absolutely be back for dinner and cocktails!

JnGtgOPpkjyWOvWM0SYEXg.review_text: popularity and change in the lower haight...parking nearly a mission impossible in the evening...over an hour wait at maven, but putting name down...finding a neighboring smelly dive bar to pass time...walking lower for another drink..past 10pm and dinner crowds dwindling down...table finally ready after an eternity...nice modern handsome space...communal long tables, small menu, high ceilings and upstairs loft seating available...drinks are well crafted, but come with a price...fancy cubes and great presentation....but, finding the food quite disappointing...the small bowl of mussels were borderline funky...quite the musty scent and tasted bad...edible, but not good...sardines preparation quite limp and boring...duck sliders just average small bites...decent fries...the only highlight being the gnocchi...seared gnocchi were fantastic with tangy curry flavors and great...come for a drink if near by and on foot, but don't drive out for the food...

DPGVbyY1x0mrvjVDyyQmTA.review_text: Had dinner and drinks at the Maven and I'm sorry to say that I was disappointed. Drinks were much better the the quality of the food. They really try and the dishes looked very good but the duck slider is the only dish that was good. The Gnocchi and the sardines was below average. Would not go back.

-Tinzjuy6qGGdEuSYVtUKw.review_text: I came here with about 3 other people and we sat at one of the communal tables. Atmosphere was nice, but service was pretty slow. Food was good, drinks were great. A little pricey for what we got. I think they're still working out the kinks...

BexYm4WjwhORYNvKrsf-nA.review_text: I went twice in the same weekend. It was excellent. Fancy drinks and great food. We tried just about everything on the menu and everything was spectacular.   Highlights? THE DUCK SLIDERS!!! I can't get them out of my mind! Soooooo good. Also, the Global Warming with the absinthe sorbet was amazing. But really you can't go wrong here. Creative and delicious!  And they have a smart menu that they can execute on. It was super crowded and the food came out fast!   Very happy to see this place open. Can't wait to go back!

V_Y2e30CvavAaA_Y63vhUw.review_text: I was too harsh on them the last time. I went back, sat on the balcony overlooking the lower level, and it was lovely. I've had one of the gin drinks and it was great. My roommate loved her cocktail that has coriander in it. Im glad I gave them a second try

SXfvHWScLghzoTSBqb_e6w.review_text: My friend and I made plans to visit Maven weeks ago, and this Friday we finally went. It did not disappoint!   There were four of us (originally 5) that walked in without a reservation around 9:00 on Friday night. The place was pretty full, but a party was luckily leaving right when we got there. It's a fairly small space, and if you're not into the communal table thing, I got bad news for you son. I personally like the communal tables; it's cozy, inexplicably hip, and you have a chance to make new friends with your neighbors.   The interior is very hipster. Long wood tables, and foliage growing out of the wall above the bar. We each ordered a specialty cocktail from their menu, and they were all very good. Mine was a bit sweet for my liking, but I'm just really sensitive to sugar. We ordered some fries, brussel sprouts, and duck sliders. The fries were very good, and the brussel sprouts were AMAZING. You absolutely need to get these.   The duck sliders were a bit of a let down. While the meat is cooked perfectly and is very juicy, my friend and I agreed it needed more flavor. Prices aren't astronomical, although they're not cheap either. Service was on point. Definitely a good spot to take a date or have a low-key night with friends!

aOyEgIxCp-1h_UOlOk95kw.review_text: This review are for the drinks only. They're good but small.  Also, really expensive. I had 2 drinks and paid $30.

SPq3BknrzT5iIcvtVUEkVA.review_text: Awesome brunch place.... The juices were fresh and French toast, fruits and eggs were awesome. Recommend it to everyone...

_HA7w1DT8rfaecC3ludKtg.review_text: Fantastic ambiance and staff. The food is amazing. Love the pairings suggested. You have got to try the cheese plate and duck sliders.

hHt3_evtz-WrLwjdbBC17Q.review_text: This place is awesome! High ceilings for a spacious feel. Great lighting with a warm feel and creative tables out of tree trunks sanded down. Food was superb, service was even better. Bartenders were very attentive and skillful with the cocktails. I believe a guy named Ryan who works there took really good care of us. Much respect!

7bAnU8PIEmAV_tUeaIdCaw.review_text: I made the mistake of coming here with a big group, but we waited anyway because I love their ambiance, their drink menu and I got to try the food once we finally sat down, the duck sliders, oh so good. The burger, cauliflower soup, crudo, gnocchi, DE-licious! The only dish I didn't like were the fried brussel sprouts, too greasy for me. Everything else was excellent! I would definitely come back, but with alot less people.

3gC8ltpCbpzHAGFh5u1hiw.review_text: Awesome space...cool setup. Really, really good brussel sprouts, food and cocktails.  Worth a trip to the Lower Haight to divulge.

ZsN29cZsMskeTwGfTfUrjw.review_text: Catching up with a friend or loved one and need a cozy spot for drinks? Maven is a place to consider! If you get the chance, head upstairs because there is a fireplace, couches, and a more intimate feel in the atmosphere. I will graciously let you all share my Maven parlor.   All of their drinks are tasty and if you aren't sure what to order, ask the friendly servers!   Words of wisdom: It is very busy during Friday nights and weekends, naturally. I would suggest coming here Mon. - Thur. because seating (and parking...) is not a huge issue. Try their special concoctions. I would make suggestions but the menu changes. It can be pricey, especially if you stay long (which you will...let's not lie to ourselves).  Bottom's up!

8Z9ugoA4MGwiJVh-CB8bhQ.review_text: Maven has done a good job of maintaining that "local, casual neighborhood spot" vibe (as per their website). It feels more like a neighborhood gem rather than an overly popular "hotspot" where folks from all over the Bay Area know about and flock to here in the city causing waits to go in excess of an hour for a casual weekend brunch (see Zazie's)  Gorgeous, lofted space with beautiful, wooden communal tables throughout, we swung by for brunch the other weekend. The omelette and the Eggs Benedict we ordered did their job however I keep hearing how Maven is a place for cocktails. Their mixologist must be pretty fantastic. I would for sure come back to catch up with a friend over drinks and perhaps their small bites. I would come back and give their dinner menu a chance. Another time...

2Ul7JOPv4PwAwhmF0WlUag.review_text: A ridiculously long wait. Pretentious bartender. It's the Haight street. Hipsters surround you. Their fancy sustainable food awaits. After an hour or so wait time.   We got some starter drinks at the bar during said waiting. Really believe that they were overthought concoctions. Simplify and they can very delicious.   Finally grabbed a seat. Food was mediocre. The duck sliders were the highlight and that is saying a lot. The burger was bland. The fish was forgettable.   For a place so hyped up by the zombie hipster masses. It doesn't live up to it...

426IAYOuscDp4KzKa1_mcg.review_text: Yummy scallop crudo and very appetizing cocktails. I especially liked the open space which also allows patrons to view the kitchen. The ambiance is very hip and young. Our waiter was friendly and helpful to suggest some plates we might enjoy. However, the price point for the dishes are a little high considering the amount of food one gets.

eRdoHH5W0Ltrkbf7XDZIMg.review_text: The food here is beyond marginal and overpriced.  The charcuterie plate was $18 and came with what seemed to be Ritz crackers.  The pate was meh and there was barely any salami. Raw oysters are some of my favorites and something about Maven's seemed slightly off.  The saving grace was the duck sliders, but that alone is not enough to bring me back.  The worst part was the fact that they charge $6 for a beer and only give you 10oz of it.

RbwHFSWgVul0IG_o88L8CQ.review_text: Is this a bar or restaurant? No one knows man.   Regardless, the place is a gem in the dive bars of Lower Haight. Finally, a rather classy bar that isn't crawling with gutterpunks or yuppies.   Do not eat here just for the food. The portions are hella tiny for the price and you will leave hungry.   The drinks and food are paired amazingly well, and you should eat and drink the way it was meant to be eaten.   Service is very good, never had to wait more than 15 minutes, even with a large party of 6.

A-G12XwH1tBb6GyyKxjHLg.review_text: Mostly service is the reason for the poor review.  First hte positives - Told us an hour wait for 4 on a Friday, ended up being 20 min - I appreciate over estimations on this rather than be surprised with a longer wait so kudos to hostess. - Community tables (3) are high and well spaced.  great vibe and decor in general - Drinks are fantastic - curious as why no specialty vodka cocktails but in my party of 4 we all got different ones - New Boy Valentine and Vixen were favorites on the group.   The bad: - Pretty slow service from the start - right when we sat down we said fries and calamari - never got the calamari and when we asked - they said must have been miscommuncation.  As a new restaurant I would encourage folks to assume service mistake vs putting it on us.  Wait was fairly long between order and then our drink order and then food order.  However, when we put a credit card down on the bill and were waiting for our friend in the rest room to include his card, we had no less than 4 people in 30 seconds ask if they could take the check.  Put the check clear on the waiter alone so we don't have to say 4 times we are not ready to pay. - Fairly limited food menu - tried a lot as we shared plates and nothing knocked the socks off.  Had Sliders, crudo, winter tart, Braised fennel and watercress and it was all just ok.  Portions are very small so wouldn't advise sharing at this place with more than one other person.  Would go back for drinks and that's probably it.

nu7zkAsgVwesHyopYXl7iA.review_text: Maven's third weekend serving brunch, and it's a swing and a miss. I expected more given my previous great dining experiences, even on busy weekend evenings.  My girlfriend and I arrived at 12:45 and were told to expect a 45 minute wait by the (hard-to-track-down) host. We wandered down Haight St for about 25 minutes to kill time, since there were a few groups in front of us, and when we came back, were one of the last parties waiting outside. Despite the upstairs counter being fully seated when we checked in, they weren't seating anyone else upstairs, and empty 2-4 tops at the shared downstairs seating weren't being cleared away in any kind hurry. We checked with the host a couple more times and weren't told anything encouraging or given an explanation for the stretched wait. The group of three in front of us got to loiter inside around 1:50, though it didn't sound like they were being seated proper yet, and said they had waited for 1:20 despite being told under 45 minutes. We were finally seated at the bar around 2 PM.  Once we got a seat, things turned around. The maple/ginger/sage breakfast links were fantastic, and the bartender mixed a great Bloody Mary riff with tomato water, tequila, and mezcal. The smashed potatoes were tasty and not dried out, and the bacon-cheddar scone was a great starter.  I'll come back, but I'll be second-guessing the host's wait times. Maven's dinner and bar have been great, so I'm surprised that they had such a tough time with brunch. It's wild speculation whether they were short on kitchen or waitstaff, but I hope they get it worked out.

Vt1obP5AhV5YI0p1HG8zSA.review_text: Maven is the embassy for foreigners north of us in the land beyond the hill.  I regularly see diners gaze deeply into the eyes of their retina displays versus the people they're with.  The latter critique is for all hoods, not just my friends up Fillmore.    Drinks are decent, little over-priced.  Food, nothing to tell mama about unless you have the unlimited plan and are dining at Maven.

ItuJ3KfxtoPUVW1XNtk-9A.review_text: Fun concept. All dishes have a cocktail pairing option. Not sure why so few restaurants do this. The food is good but not great. Cocktails however are really well made and are awesome. There were two of us and they offered to split all the pairings in two glasses for us. Nice touch.  My fave cocktail was the Swedish Cup. Desserts (esp. the warm pear tart) were a bit of a let down. Service is adequate.   Two negative points: They don't accept reservations and all tables are communal.

wm4TvmaCkeYjPGlKv9PMag.review_text: Good drinks, on a fun pairing menu. Get the kobe burger if you're really hungry, it's drool-inducing.

6Mb8ha111OyHHmfswe9niw.review_text: --UPDATE:  I was able to reach the owner and the whole situation is fixed. It was a simple error as it can happen to everyone.  I have to say that the owner of the place was super fast to come back to me and to make things right.... This is great.  --ORIGINAL:  They charged me 72.73 $ on my credit card for a bill of 35 $ .

wwRNC1NAblVQSgyvCevNfQ.review_text: I visited this place from out of town on a recommendation and it was fantastic. The innovative cocktails were amazing of the 3 I sampled. Absinthe sorbet slowly melting into your drink was certainly a nice touch in the "Global Warming". Duck sliders are a must if you're doing more than just cocktails. Maven is definitely worth checking out if you live nearby or are just swinging into town.

1w3brs6DYDuWbvSYFkzvPg.review_text: "Are those plants coming out of the wall real?"  "Uh. Maybe?"  "Okay. Well, this butternut squash pasta thing is uh-mazing."  "Yup."  My friend and I went here last night to check it out after I had gotten ten inches of my hair chopped off at Firehorse across the street. We sat down and settled on the Butternut Squash Agnolotti, the Savory Winter Tart, and what they simply label on their menu as "Cheese" (Point Reyes Blue with Spiced Honey).  Neither of us are drinking at the moment (damn those NYE resolutions) and I think that an earthy pinot could have really brought out the flavors in both the Winter Tart and Butternut Squash dishes, but c'est la vie.  We definitely agreed that the Butternut Squash dish was our favorite; you have an option to order a small or large plate for this dish...get the large, we definitely wanted more.  The tart was more of a, uh...deconstructed tart? so the filling was decoratively plated and the tart crust was broken up into pieces on top. It was good, but trying to fork together the crust with the filling was a bit challenging, especially when trying to share this dish.  I'm not really going to review the cheese cause, well, they didn't exactly make it now did they? The spiced honey was a nice touch, I'll give them that.  On ambiance, it was pleasant with a couple small hiccups. On the ground level where we sat (I didn't see the upstairs seating), there are no hooks for bags or coats anywhere. Our stuff was on the floor which wasn't ideal. I believe I overheard the host offer to take someone's coat, but for bags, I'd probably want to keep that close by as I'm usually toting my Macbook. Secondly, the tables are shared and long and narrow and the servers have to pass behind you to get to people on the other end; a little awkward, but not awful.  So, if you're in Lower Haight and want something a little nicer than bar food or BBQ, Maven is a good option.

V8cq6dkQ8ct79V8anR0dIg.review_text: **** for the drinks.  Yummy bourbon drinks that got me wasted.  Pricey but good. (about $11 on average)  ** for the food.  It wasn't that exciting.  We tried 5 different things and it wasn't bad, but when we drop $140 on dinner, I kinda want to say to myself, "Damn, that was effin good!", but I was more like, "Hmmm, ok, but not worth the price".    Cool interior and nice service.  People seem to dig them, but I would rather cross the street, grab a sausage at Rosamunde and crush a Pliny at Toronado.

yB4E71S4On0ArNGmxH9_Sw.review_text: Great experience.  I love when restaurants provide good service, and obviously good food and drink (we are lucky in SF), but I am super impressed when the small details are paid attention to, as well.  Here is a new concept of pairing food and cocktails - genius. Food was fresh, local and delicious. Cocktails were original and were very good.  In addition, the decor is gorgeous - living wall, beautiful lighting, gorgeous wooden bar and a cool bathroom (that gets big points in my book).  Great experience - we'll be back.

6_VkzelWeSHzjTVDlGl-Ug.review_text: FOOD: 1.) Duck Sliders = Yumm 2.) Oysters = mmm  Loved everything here :)))) Presentation was great too!  SERVICE: Good  ATMOSPHERE: Love the atmosphere. Small, cozy, modern, nice.. great for a date... got to sit at the bar although they had a mezzanine n sitting anywhere would've been nice :) And amidst lower haight so there's bars and other things to do around the area. And not far few blocks away from Alamo Sq with the painted Ladies :)

gfAQZWlijXNII529ldPS2Q.review_text: Great drinks, great service.  A welcome addition to the lower Haight.  Looking forward to drinking here again!

ch4WBlNa442BE48Tq0jpvw.review_text: Hands down best Bloody Mary I've ever had. This place is amazing for brunch. My friends and I had a handful of items including their duck hash, billionaire's bacon, and banh mi. The banh mi was my favorite! It beats out any other banh mi I've ever had (don't tell my people I said that). I assume the menu is ever changing, but the ambiance will surely remain cool, trendy, and hipster (in a good way).   I love the living wall!!! And the music choice here gets my stamp of approval.

0SGLIKAxew4PLsY4TZMWww.review_text: Double dated it up here last Thursday night.  Place was bumpin but not overcrowded.  We had Boonte and Racer 5 on tap as well as some house reds.  Following a long bike ride, we avoided the small plates and everyone went for the burgers ($11) and sides of fries with olive aioli.  The olive aioli was insane, such an interesting change from ketchup.  Wish they had more variety on the menu in larger quantities but we'll definitely be back for drinks soon.

kiUVG0dPJJKUS84CAf0zaw.review_text: I thought I would not like this place. And it is a little loud, a little too full of hipsters, a little too cool for school. But the truth is, the drinks are amazing, the beers are amazing, and the food is really, really tasty. Maven is not cheap, and you're not going to feel really full, but the flavors are going to be very very good.

k95XbDLcyVLLJbJB2JlKhA.review_text: Yummmm and great vibe! I've been on several occasions and all were great. Whether upstairs in the cool lounge area or downstairs at the prep bar, Maven is a fun casual and stimulating experience. Mixology is my description from food to beverage. The Burger is scrumptious and so are the duck sliders. The menu has a tasting lineup, for every dish there is an appropriate distilled or fermented counterpart. Give it a whirl and definitely sit at the prep bar and see just what goes into plating each dish. You'll thank me!!!

JL23YrKlDRgF24ZFuHinKg.review_text: What a great job Maven did with the old RNM space.  The downstairs is very cool with lots of communal tables and an awesome living garden hanging behind the bar.  It definiltey feels more like a fun bar with snacks and apps versus a restaurant.  I went here with 2 girlfriends last week and we decided to share a bunch of plates.  The menu is pretty small and the portions are also small.  We had the almonds and fries from the bar bites menu - both were great.  We also had the burger - it was OK.  Not a great burger, but not bad.    We also had the mushroom tart (interesting, but good) and the duck sliders (which were probably our favorite).  The strange thing is they only have 1 dessert on the menu - which did not appeal to any of us... so we opted to hit up the Ice Cream Bar down the street in Cole Valley (good choice)!  We had a great time and the service was great.  The only thing we did feel is that we were rushed out of there.  All of the plates we ordered came out at pretty much the same time (I hate when they don't time it out right).   I'd go back to this place... but with the thought of only drink and maybe snacking - I would not plan on having a full dinner here again.

zMBjT8Fau5hIrJuF8JIjvA.review_text: Stumbled upon Maven by accident and was very pleasantly surprised. The menu is exceptionally creative offering small plates with pairings of both cocktails and beer and wine. Homemade pickles, duck sliders, potato gnocchi, and the fudgesicle and their cocktail pairings were all fantastic.

i5o9heILJtx3Yrwm-BdviQ.review_text: 1 Three Little Birds 1 New Boy Valentine 2 Nauti' Mermaid(s) Kennebec Fries ----------------------------- Total: $51.47 (sans tip)  The place was happening on a Thursday night. The bar made for awesome QT-catch up w/ a friend. The upstairs looked inviting but was surprisingly empty. Looks like a nice date nook.  Come for the curiosity of what replaced RNM, but stay for the amazing cocktails.  You bet your hip'n'trendy fancypants I'll be back, with company in tow.

xyqnCAQsARyayfkl0dSNKg.review_text: I was expecting this to be another New American type of joint, but I was pretty blown away by the creativity of the food and the presentation. We ordered the brussels sprouts (apple gastrique), rainbow trout with melted leeks, and winter squash soup with ROOT BEER MARSHMALLOWS. All very seasonal dishes and the ingredients were very fresh and tasty. I was most impressed by the soup as most chefs wouldn't have the creativity or the guts to pair savory with sweet, but I love it when chefs do that and it works. How do they know the flavors go together?! Well, at Maven they do.   Didn't get a chance to try any drinks as it was a weekday night, but they're featured quite prominently on the menu, and seems to be one of the highlights of the restaurant as well. Will just have to go back to try them.

cs6Lum7cQq5a7flTMnAvsg.review_text: They have a tasty selection of drinks.  Very short food menu.  We had the salmon tartare appetizer and it had the most wonderful eggs salad accompanying it.  We also had the duck sliders and it was good but slightly salty.  The gnocchi entree was also good but maybe a tad expensive.  Overall, it was tasty.

tD1a0zdA1UvjBIH7vHKK3w.review_text: OK I haven't been back here but the owner/ manager wrote me a great personal message about my experience, which was awesome. They noted that their gnocchi portions are bigger, after seeing feedback They also offered to explain any questions I had on the drink menu, and pointed out that they love talking about the different spirits and components. I was dead wrong- this place isn't pretentious, maybe just the hipsters who come here are. We will be back fo sho!

dy4OvKg-9GBhgGaZFaKqTQ.review_text: For a sec I thought I was @ Plum, that's how good this place is. The calamari perfect cooked two ways (fried & grilled) with that spicy sauce was incredible, as were the duck sliders and the asparagus with farm egg. The coktails were just as good as the Alembic and the atmosphere cool, mellow & intimate. I'ts my new go-to spot for grub and drinks.

ObdEx0uci1jRa4dDM73AYg.review_text: The portions here are small! I ordered the dinner sized version of the summer squash ravioli, but it really wasn't that much food. The dish itself was quite good but not very filling.   Cocktails on the other hand are yummy and strong!

EK6YJiey5K6hkKcbonY9lg.review_text: If you're a regular dinner-goer who just wants food that justifies its price tag - Maven will seem overrated and overpriced. If you're a scenester, on a date where atmosphere/hipness is more important than the food, or if you simply like gawping at gigantic plants bursting out of concrete walls - man, I've got the perfect place for you.  The portions are tiny. I'm no Joey Chestnut, but the ratio of food to $ is ridiculous. Seriously, if you break it down, you end up paying about $3/oyster, $3/half-dollar-sized ravioli, $3/slider. Granted, the duck sliders were delicious (the most delicious thing on the menu, imho), but I'd take In-n-Out over that slider any day, especially since you have to have like 5 to feel decently full. Or even better, you could go to Chinatown for the real deal and get half a Peking duck. Oh, and the pasta that we got was also way past al dente and somewhat mushy.   What you're paying for at Maven is the atmosphere. Some people like doing that - to each his/her own - but I prefer to pay for good food.

7aGDxEpGb2-2UP228Y1ToA.review_text: I've been to Maven twice now-once on the weekend, once during the week. Both experiences were very similar. I love the set up of the restaurant with their tables, and the service is spot on. Cocktails are great, and the duck sliders really live up to the expectations. However, one order is just two tiny sliders for $9. THe dungeness crab and arctic char were both really good, but I definitely could have used more food on the plate. The broccoli agnolotti I didn't care for - it lacked flavor and I wasn't a fan of the texture.  All in all, the atmosphere is great and concept of the menu is too. However, the menu could use more options and the portion sizes are just way too small for the price. There is no way I could feel good about spending the amount of money I would have to in order to feel satiated.

iu70nwr37uHgwpob-yscxw.review_text: This is my new favorite spots for drinks. The bartenders are fun and friendly and their drinks are amazing. My absolutely favorite was the avalanche, ended up ordering multiple because it was so tasty! Egg white based sweet but light drink. Gorgeous location with a friendly vibe. Enjoy for quick drinks or dinner and drinks with friends--communal tables and the burger and fries were a hit!

PMWNrwuvrTwb4robAfoUhw.review_text: I really wanted to like this place so that I could have another go-to spot in the neighborhood.  There were eight of celebrating a friend's birthday.  Since reading on Yelp that Maven is more of a bar than a restaurant and the food is hit and miss, we all dined elsewhere before meeting.  I'd expected to walk into a packed bar, but at 9pm the place was dead.  For a Saturday night in Lower Haight, that says something right there.  Nonetheless, it worked out for us because it meant we got a sofa upstairs in the cozy lounge.    We must have had the same waiter as others have mentioned here, totally lacking any personality, but what they hey, maybe he was just having a(nother) bad night.  For a cocktail bar we were a bit non-plussed that they had only one type of vodka.  How weird is that?  But then maybe it's not a bar in the traditional sense of a bar, i.e. a place where people go to have a few drinks and even some fun.  And here's why I say that.  After two drinks we were told to leave because we had had too much to drink witnessed by the fact that we had broken two glasses.  Seriously.  The glasses were broken by the birthday girl who in her 8 inch heels misjudged stepping out of the tight space and knocked a glass off the coffee table, and then another.   We were totally shocked.  We are a group of highly educated people, business owners, renowned designers... and one Yelp reviewer.  Anyway, if you don't want our money, we're happy to take it elsewhere.  Thankfully, there's Nickie's down the street where they encourage people to have a good time.  Needless to say, we won't be going back.

ReDoGveUTyzlfC0bZOQ3bA.review_text: I didn't try any of the small plates, but between myself and two friends, we managed to try the whole cocktail list. They were all super good with the global warming being my personal favorite.  The bar area was at that happy medium of not crowded but far from dead, and the owners really used the space wisely, opting for communal tables downstairs and single seating above looking down. Overall, a really polished place.  And apparently there's a fireplace upstairs.... so distressing that I missed this :(

uXybf-Hg0cpCHj8i7C2lIQ.review_text: It was a casual Sunday evening after a whole day of city walk, me and my friend passed by Maven and thought it would be fun to check it out.   We got seated right away, ordered a couple small plates and they all tasted very good. We had oyster, The Monterey Calamari and Chocolate mousse Napoleon with Maven's milk punch. I love the big ice ball in my cocktail, cool stuff!

2Qfa3o72sq04_MCUxy3Shg.review_text: I remember when Maven first opened and it was all a buzz with mixed Yelp reviews. This made me hesitant so... naturally... I stayed away; until it was suggested as the perfect post engagement party nosh.   I've walked by it at least 20 times a month since its opened, peering inside, not really taking stock of the decor- but dude, its really nice! I was like, wow how did i totally miss this!? And to TOP IT OFF-- they make a mean burger. Like, I liked it better than Nopa's. YEAH. Its that good. I learned my lesson- I will totally be back.

-g3XIcCb2b-BD0QBCcq2Sw.review_text: So, Maven.  It's been on the to-do list, especially since it's got such an interesting concept - cocktail pairings with food. I (literally) tortured myself for 21 days during January where I abstained from gluten, sugar (mostly processed, but even some natural), and alcohol.  It was rough, I'm not going to lie.  So how else to reward some hard fought battles? Cocktails.  Greg and I wandered over to the Lower Haight on a relatively quiet but chilly Monday to seek out some food, with my eyes set on Maven's Chinatown Duck Sliders and brussels sprouts.  The ambiance/decor here is just so cool, it's got that urban/modern loft look with some awesome living garden work on the walls.  We sat up in the mezzanine area and ordered the following: Beverages: 5 Spot Cocktail, Cabernet Blend / Maudite Food: Chinatown Duck Sliders, Gnocchi, Brussels Sprouts, Pork Loin with Mustard Seeds, and the Chocolate Fudgesicle Sundae.  The highlights was the 5 Spot Cocktail, the Brussels Sprouts, and the Fudgesicle. I was "meh" on the Duck Sliders.  I wasn't overly impressed with the whole situation.  I know it's on 7x7's Big Eat list, blah blah blah, but I didn't finish my slider thinking that I had a life changing moment.  At the end of the day, Maven is a cocktail that pairs its specialties with food, not the other way around.  Drinks here are fantastic, but for what you pay for the food, it makes it a little bit of a lackluster experience.

_zF7NsCM44kDyiM-mpYK7A.review_text: How did we end up at Maven?  It was a spontaneous Thursday after work night and my girlfriends and I wanted to dine around town.  Literally, dine around town.  This was our second stop of the night.  One of the general managers there was super cool!  We wanted to order our food but didn't see our serve in sight so we called for him and he came over and took our orders down.  He was very friendly and made us feel very comfortable.  We ordered the Chinatown duck sliders, mussels, and king salmon.  I could live without the duck sliders.  They were good, but lacked some flavor IMO.  My favorite was the mussels. I even drank the soup it was in.  MMmmmmmm delicious! The salmon of course was good. I love anything salmon.  It had a nice tangy potato kick to it, too!

SxAZs8m5rcYwj8WwDOGUrA.review_text: This place has it all, food, decor, ambiance, multiple generational appeal.  What do i mean?  If you're over 30 or on a date you will definitely appreciate the balcony.  It's where you get cushy upholstered furniture, fireplace, drink & food service.  Downstairs you will feel part of the in-crowd that enjoys music so loud you have trouble talking, high stools with no back support on communal tables, and the same fantastic drinks and food.  It's up to you to decide where you belong.  Don't tell too many people about the upstairs.  Great place to go with a business expense account, celebration, or splurge.  We ordered everything off the food menu.  Loved everything, especially the duck sliders.  There's only one dessert.  The drinks rule, as well as take up most of the menu.  You get the picture.  Plan on spending some $$$ & time here. If you have a large group, arrive before 8p as Maven gets really crowded and they don't take rez.

FjSwrlcU3ZSvcohOxUCtyg.review_text: They have very creative cocktails, and each of their tapas plates were amazing. This is the only place where I've enjoyed eggplant. The rainbow trout was also incredibly juicy and flavorful.

LLDM6tGU3PDfn966LcMCSg.review_text: Maven does a really good job in paring their food with the appropriate cocktail, beer or wine.  Went on a Friday around 7pm and was surprised just how crowded it was.  It was only about a 15 min wait luckily, and well worth it at that.  The waiters here are very knowledgeable and descriptive in their recommedations and make it very easy for the customers to pinpoint what exactly they are looking for.  My friend had the Arctic Char which had the perfect texture flavor, and the skin was cooked to a perfect crispness.  Highly recommend that.  While I had the Monterey Calamari,  which was a combination of perfectly lightly battered pieces, and the tentacles were not breaded, but had that perfect chewiness and added a great color to the dish.  The thai chili, and the sauce are a great compliment to this dish as well.  I also recommend this. The waiter also did a wonderful job of recommending a drink to go with my dish.  I got the Border Crosser which is Mezcal, Bourbon, Amaro, and Vermouth.  Such great flavors and nowhere near as overpowering as I expected which is a good thing.  My only gripe was that it was a little pricey for the size.  The ambiance is a very dark but not a sleepy place.  Good mixture of people def a 25-35 year old crowd.  The tables are long raised tables with stools and with jacket hooks underneath the table.   I would suggest this to anyone and everyone and look forward to going back soon.

YJa0eHECjvciDBEylm-LOw.review_text: Chef isaac's Chinatown duck Sliders and king salmon crudo might be the best thing I've eaten all year.

HxW-a6QMGzXQSYcJKtIjoQ.review_text: Did I just get home and make a sandwich after spending $65 here?  Yes..  That's too bad, some of the food was pretty good.  But portion size is so small it's hard to justify going back there. Drinks, good but small Olives, really good Scallop crudo, did not work at all, don't bother.  And for $12, come on. Duck sliders, tasty, but $9 for 2 little sliders... broccoli ravioli, nice arctic char - $23 for a piece of fish, a bit of veggies, and then they drown it in broth and make it soggy.. no thanks. Some hits, some misses, but definitely more expensive than it should be.  I've got a bunch of other places to drop $65 and feel full and satisfied.

3JMY7N7dsaQsjqwN5cZUVQ.review_text: Update. downgrade.  I've been here 4 times nows, all on a Friday right after work. The first couple times the place was totally over crowded and it took a while to be seated. Over the visits the crowds were progressively smaller. The last visit the place was totally empty on a Friday evening. I actually asked if they were even open which they were.  The last meal (and it will be my last meal there) I ordered the burger. It was hands-down the worst I have ever had. They soak the meat in Angostura bitters. You can't taste anything but that crap. With this method they could use the best beef or pink slime and the burger would taste the same. If you like your burger devoid of any beefy-taste this is the place for you.  The bartenders and staff are nice enough.   There are just way too many other places in the City for a real burger. Save your money.

PQmK3o8t5FtW_2Q_RR7hWA.review_text: My boyfriend and I love to go here for drinks and food. It is a little pricey but the drinks are so worth it. The food is hit or miss. The burger is YUMMY. The squash tortellini, not so much.

Suw8tiW7EHWpt7HhuB7SDw.review_text: You'd always wanted to live in a semi-industrial loft, but the thought of leaving your railroad-style apartment split you in two - just like the bath is.  With the exception of the "living wall", something about the concrete, wire railing and wood slab communal table tops just takes me back.  With a NOPA alum behind the bar and a former Beretta GM as one of the minds behind the concept, you can't go wrong with a cocktail here. If the downstairs bar is full, cozy up next to some new friends at seats along the upstairs rail.  Maven adds the touch of class the Lower Haight deserves and was lacking. Your neighborhood options now span beyond some dives and a wine bar. Hallelujah.  If only they had more than one dessert option...  but really, can you go wrong with the plate of two spiced brownies and house-made cardamom ice cream?  ***  Fifth star warranted after the last visit.  Food: +Duck Sliders - Like Whoa. Get this. Two petite buns chock full of awesome. Spice, tang, intense juicy shredded duck is going to warrant the last bit of the bun to wipe up the extra sauce. +Scallop Crudo - Well prepared, but sadly over-powered as they were served after the Sliders. +Arctic Char - Cooked to perfection. Reiterate: Perfection. Crisp skin, moist, flaky flesh. Balanced with well seasoned, balanced broth/fume and vegetables.  Cocktails: Damaging. In the best of ways, wallet aside. Having shared / sipped through nine different libations to date  - they are: complex, balanced and unique  Service: We grilled this guy about every detail from how the pistachio was achieved in the Hometown Vixen (roasted in-house, soaked in bourbon and pressed) to the difference between gomme and syrup. Impressive.  After you sip through a few, you're gonna wanna park yourself near the fireplace on the couches in the loft...  Get here before it gets to you.

4eR6hYFJcBHoAqhuOS07ww.review_text: -------BLOOMSPOT DEAL----- Four courses with 4 cocktail pairings is such a great deal. Really great venue and the perfect place for a date or to meet a group of friends.  Food highlights for me: Chinatown Duck sliders - SO juicy and savory. Yum Autumn Chestnut Ravioli - Light but so flavorful. Plus I love ravioli  Be sure to ask for a seat upstairs at the balcony so you can have a great view of the restaurant.

umaFa8I7hJGQ6eF5FfY-jw.review_text: Loved the cocktails! Had one with chamomile and one with chartreuse- both delicious. Calamari was tasty. Staff was friendly.

Jtfz1WbIB_FtYDkO3MtRXg.review_text: I met up with a bunch of people here and I was surprised that we got a table pretty quickly to fit our big group. The food was good and so were the drinks. They have cocktails and beer. I was pleased with the service because even though some people in our group took a while to make a selection the wait staff was patient.

2_cvh63d0CM33n1cP-3YZA.review_text: Came in very briefly for drinks over the weekend and it was FANTASTIC. The bartender was great at giving recommendations and all the drinks are really delicious. The ambiance of the whole place is very natural and airy, and the menu looked really good. Didn't get a chance to try the food, but I'll definitely be back in the coming weeks for brunch.

8KCv7lNNr62bJw0ShvBAOQ.review_text: What it do YELP!? It's ya girl, it's been awhile. First of all, I've come to the realization that I am definitely a creeper. I am creeping away on these food photos all the time but so inactive, like a silent far away admirer.. but I love u yelp food photos. ANYWAYS I decided to come out! So here I am, Anna the Food Creeper is here to review Maven.  Maven, I came here with some friends and I was definitely creeping on you. I saw your Salmon Curdo with mash potatoes OMG u look so good so fly so everything. But the menu changes everyday so I didn't get to try you.. which was a shame.  However, we tried a couple things, and my favorite was the Rosemary Roasted Figs. Omg so GOOOD WTHELL IM SO MAD THINKING ABOUT HOW GOOD THEY ARE. Cut each fig into two, add a little burrata and surryano ham and Maven, I am a fannnn~ I also really liked the kennebec fries! I didn't really like the duck sliders even though everyone's raving about them. It kinda tasted like a chinese bao and chinese baos are like 1 dollar... And didn't like the Housemade pickles and the PEI mussels were tiny as shits. Sometimes bigger is better yaknow.  But overall Maven, you won me over with them figs and my Global Warming drink. I applaud you! Clap Clap

N0y70IgvQ8XLvEVyrBaFHA.review_text: we completely fall in love with the place! we sat by the bar, enjoyed attention received from the staff, and loved watching what they cooked!   Cocktails: fresh ingredients, unique cocktails at reasonable price.. You can't beat that. It's about $9-12 range compared with $15+ in chicago (for the same quality of cocktails). we tried 3-4 random one. they are all good!   Our favorite dish was the simple sashimi (fresh fish with some chill oil). we can't remember the exact name but it was amazing. I wish there are more selections in the menu. They offer small plates. They have ~10 plates. For small plates, you probably order half of the menu for 2+ parties. I just wish they have more to pick from. Food was good!!

EjWOCA1kT3MpWofzjrVtfg.review_text: Everything here is delicious - that means food and drinks.  It gets pretty crowded so come early, come late, or expect to wait. The knowledgeable staff makes for great recommendations.  Service can be a little slow, especially if you are sitting by the windows versus the aisles.  Just about all of the first floor seating is communal so if you are wary of Stranger Danger try to snag a seat upstairs.  This place is great if you are having some drinks after work, want to get your palate wet before a night out, or just want to have a nice light dinner with some special people.

tyOr6NpS35q7fnPjHNQ9KQ.review_text: We had an excellent brunch recently. We were walking from The Metro Hotel to take Muni to BART and wanted to get brunch somewhere after our night out on the town. We had originally planned on going to The Grind but that place was so damned packed and frankly, the food on the plates we saw just looked sad.   We decided to sit at the bar. I beg bar designers reading this to please put a foot bar at the bottom of your bars. Stools without foot rest bars for anyone over six feet makes you very uncomfortable.
