We both did not opt for cocktails because we were a little crispy from the night before but had loose leaf tea.   My wife ordered the Confit Benedict with Tomato Hollandaise($13). They call it a B.L.T. Benedict. It was delicious. The flavors all melded together and the dish was awesome. I had the Maven Burger($12). Another great choice. Great components, cooked more mid-rare than requested medium but the flavors of the cheese and onions were delicious. Unfortunately they did not come with fries but house-made potato chips that were dusted in coriander powder which sufficed.   The service was friendly and nice. The bartender made some very pretty cocktails for customers in front of us and when we go back, we would love to try some of Maven's creations. The meal was affordable and we would love to try their dinner menu sometime. Bravo.

1yRxNijLVY6IKFHZIo_ynQ.review_text: YUM. The brunch food was to die for. My friend and I got here sometime after two on a Saturday afternoon, we had the souffle pancake, and the suckling pig, eggs benedict. My friend had the absinthe sorbet drink and I had some other drink. My drink wasn't memorable but her's was amazing. It was a fun experience with the sorbet absinthe, AND it tasted good.   The souffle pancake was light and fluffy and not really a pancake but more of a wonderful piece of delicious cloudlike pancake with apple butter and cinnamon sugar on the side. Geez.   Suckling pig eggs benedict... i couldn't really taste the suckling pig/see much of it but they did something with the greens on my benedict. I don't know how much delicious bacon grease or crack they might have put in it but man, the greens tasted better than the meat/egg. Something you won't ever find me claiming.   Anyways. Stop reading my review and just come here already.

40bbIS9joC1kEZWKrE-kow.review_text: Whoa! Yum. I came because I heard it had one of the best burgers in SF. It was definitely up there, but the duck sliders and gnocchi really stole the show. Another star added on here for the incredibly cool (and not bad looking) wait staff, and great cocktails.

AptFz6Una1CnZlchLX65rA.review_text: The food is closer to 3.5 (at least my burger and fennel salad were), but the place is new and so I'm optimistic that they will figure out their niche.  But the ambiance, wine, and mixed drinks are amazing!  The communal seating is a place - everywhere is bar seating.  And we sat in front of the kitchen which was very entertaining because we could see the chefs cook the dishes in front of us.  So yea, for the locals, Maven has lots of potential and I expect big things out of it.

dR_HHVOTfH9dFx86fldcew.review_text: Maven is a bit of an enigma. Surprisingly, it's oddly reminiscent of RNM, the failed restaurant that preceded it in the same space.  The problem isn't the concept.  We're love our dranks, and so we're totally down with a restaurant that pushes drinks front and center. That's why we love Beretta, one of the places these dudes used to run.  Go have a bunch of great drinks and eat some good food in between.  We've been going there for years, early in the evening with the kids, later wild times when it's just us, Sunday brunch.  The drinks at Maven are just as good, and served with as much care. The food is even better, of a whole category (or two) above Beretta.  We had grilled fennel with burrata that got sicker with every bite and a butternut squash ravioli that was rich and deep.  The entree was an exquisite piece of grilled char, cooked 1 millimeter above the legal limit and served with a light broth that hit like champagne or something. Wicked.  But therein lies the problem,  The food is too good for the concept. Or, at least, the two don't match.  I'll give it to them: the Mezcal drink they paired with that grilled fennel rang a very real bell in my mouth.  They were great together.  But then if I'm getting pounded, I don't give a shit.  I don't want a deep eating experience when the menu is 80% booze.  I want awesome drinks served right with foods that come up between and wake me up.  I was loving that delicate, pitch-perfect char they served me, but then I had a beer and some wacky bourbon drink on the table I was just wishing for some bruchetta or remoulade or something.   I'm rooting for Maven. I live down the block and would love to have a quality spot in  the hood.  And I love Beretta, so I have faith.  But are they Delfina's or a bar?  If it's the former, flesh out the food menu and slow it down on the "pairings" theme. If it's the latter, get more fun with the food, give me shit that will stand up to the booze. (Maybe it's seasonal, I know it's tough to come hard with roots and shit, but you hear me. ) And maybe I ordered wrong, but if the concept is booze + food, you gotta expect people to make bad choices.  Another plus is the interior.  The changes are subtle, but the vibe in there is now cool as shit.  Really great job on turning that space into some place cool, the plant wall, the pro kitchen. And the attic is the bomb.  I saw Bryan Ferry in line for that attic.    I give the food four stars and the drinks four starts, but not four stars together.  Also, two things: (i) you charged me $18 for six kumomotos, more than Foreign Cinema, and five out of six had shell bits in them? and (ii) we were the only people upstairs, early, and the two owners (thanks Haighteration blog) came up to sit at the bar and talk business.  30 minutes they were there, we were here, and neither of them ever came over and said what's up.  What's up.

fSzJO3tSVQ6DNx6jNf_fzA.review_text: $150 for a party of 4. We had 5 drinks, 3 tapas plates, and 3 entree sized plates.  The burger, brisket, gnocchi, and duck sliders were true standouts. The salmon seemed portioned for a kids meal, at adult prices.

fVUGECEZMCqKO1WCTIHtdA.review_text: What a hidden gem. The potato something was divine. Love the trout and mixed greens with goat cheese. We had 5 large plates, 2 desserts, 5 drinks for $125.00. It was AMAZING. The specialty drinks were so thirst quenching. But tasty. Thank you guys for a blast. We had a great and delicious experience but not at typical SF costs.

jkn6J1-sl5AaYkfXvYrVWA.review_text: I was mtg up with a friend and 3 of his other friends on a sunday night.  He suggested this spot.  To my knowledge he's NEVER been here either.  My friend and my 2 siblings also came along.  This place is very trendy and modern.  Just how u'd find a lounge in OC.  The ambiance was very grown up, if u will.  We ordered the fries and the oysters.  Oysters were mini sized :( but still good.  This place had cool naming drinks.  Though, I ordered a mojito! My friends ordered the devil drink. . .which was strong! Everyone here was pretty friendly.   A really nice place to converse and feel like an adult!

9yrvqcVFHROnJL0qh30InQ.review_text: Great food but be prepared to eat something later. Doesn't fill you up. Good restaurant for foodies.

nqIr7jdKg6RlkpuP20JYHQ.review_text: Excellent place for cocktails! I had devils halo. Holy crap! What an amazing mixed drink!  The atmosphere is something out of a spy thriller / sherlock Holmes novel.  The service is fantastic.  I can't wait to return!

4cuAhpABHERfyQoIMCrikQ.review_text: Burger, chips and recommended beer all nice. The burger had a toasted bun that was a little burnt. It was drippy. That's how it should be.  Service was nice and easy for a party of one. I like the water service and the chips had an acidic flavored salt. They were oily but to the right level.

XWhhyQTWMF_5PDkZoHBR5g.review_text: Maven is a great place to eat and drink with friends. Really cool space here. Downstairs are communal tables which are fun, and also there is an upstairs seating area.   Cocktails: the hometown vixen was delightfully refreshing- really great flavor to the bourbon, not too bitter and not too sweet.   Food: Chinatown duck sliders were amazing- gone in 2 seconds. Also loved the fries in an aoli sauce which was killer. The dungeness crab needs improvement (kind of blah) and wouldn't recommend that one.  Dessert: Mayan chocolate- was basically a brownie with an interesting spice flavor. As a chocolate lover, it was hard for me to appreciate the spice because I was hoping it would be... well... more chocolaty.   I had a great time here and will return someday to try the other cocktails.

yrbHvk9aJBx-CALserE-Pw.review_text: Came here for dinner and drinks with a friend last night. Service was uniformly excellent. We had the Brussels sprouts, the mussels, and the short ribs.  The mussels were tasteless and underseasoned, but the other two dishes were very good.  I'd go back, but I wouldn't order the mussels.

igZHqUx_Oxjo4O41hSNkrA.review_text: One of my favorite spots in SF. It's hip and dim and lush with plant life that climbs the walls. It is also home to one of my favorite cocktails ever, the Global Warming, a delightfully complex cocktail that contains a scoop of absinthe sorbet. I also adore the duck sliders, which were SO juicy and savory, I needed more napkins in a hurry. My friend and I also shared the gnocchi, which was petite, but yummy, and a impressively flavored helping of salmon (which was her idea, and it ended up being a good one). My experience at Maven was so good, that we ended up returning, even though I was in town for just a few days. Looking forward to a delicious return!

Z88N6qly3Dp5C06XbZ9IMQ.review_text: It's easy for me to fall in love.   I just need delicious food, superb cocktails, efficient service and maybe even a nice ambiance.   Oh and SUPERB cocktails, did I already say that?   Maven has all these.   I'm fairly confident that I won't be downgrading this review even though I've only been here once, because one look at the menu and you know they've got their priorities straight: BOOZE.   Let's start by creating a kick ass drink and then think about what food to pair it with AFTER the fact.  An online coupon afforded us a tasting menu paired with cocktails. My favorite of the bunch being the "Fireside cocktail" which had rye whiskey and is suitably perfect for the season with its apple and cinnamon flavors. The chestnut ravioli filled with golden apples in a sherry sauce was so perfect with it, what an outstanding pairing!  The Chinatown duck sliders pair well with the 5 spot cocktail made with aged rum, ginger, Thai basil and five spice. Clearly, Asian influences all throughout! The herbed fries were crispy and sprinkled with juniper salt. The Chocolate Napoleon dessert is sooo good with the Maven Punch.   The only thing I'd like to note was the seared local Albacore was a bit salty.   At the end of our meal, I was smiling from ear to ear. (I mean, you would too, I basically had 4 amazing cocktail tastings! And at a little bit over 2 oz each, I was buzzed!)  The feel good endorphins were excitedly running in my veins so much that on my way out, I was gushing to the manager how beautifully paired everything was.   Great service and eats in a restaurant that has a surprisingly trendy ambiance for this part of town. If you LOVE the whole cocktail culture SF is experiencing right now, you can't pass up on Maven.   5 buzzworthy stars!

ezpdcYmhTUI-WiOymBp3oA.review_text: Unique cocktails, paired with small plates.  Good date spot especially if you get a table upstairs.  Food was good, cocktails were delish.  4 stars for ambiance and drinks vs. food.  Plates should be more centered around sharing vs. true dinner and think it would be better.  Overall fun spot!

IBrL-6twlZmQBGLdV2DQiw.review_text: Fun place for drinks and snacks.  Menu combinations aren't that unique, but it's good.  Bartenders are voluptuous friendly girls.  Servers are metro male cuties.  The decor is all the good things of RNM, but more earthy and casual with polished slabs of trees as communal tables on the ground floor, and counter seating on the rail upstairs to people-watch downstairs.

WtE46KFtytGA_8JqLEPXAA.review_text: Great cocktails and fantastic food.  Never understand why the wait isn't longer.  I think maybe the family style seating turns some folks off.  IMHO this place is as good as NOPA at a lower price point.   The burger is one of the best around.

D4F-XLvFCM1RSjDqj3aw2w.review_text: I think I've become an eggs benedict connoisseur because I tend to order that when at brunch.  I'm pretty sure I've had it a double-digit amount of times in SF.  I had the biscuits and gravy benedict at Maven.  It sounds heavy, but it was actually the lightest eggs benedict I've ever had.  From bottom to top:  Half a fluffy, spongey biscuit (the flour was yellow, maybe it was potato flour), a slice of herby chicken sausage (it was nice and moist), a perfectly poached egg (plump, the yolk was runny), and then the gravy.  It was a fresh take on gravy as it tasted like it had green onion or leeks in it.  It came with a side of chili potatoes.  It was definitely the lightest eggs benedict, and one of the tastiest in the city hands down.

E8hubLFgOCrN84JlpJ4e-w.review_text: -1 star for the incredibly slow bar.  Delicious cocktails, amazing food, great service (except for the slow bar) - worth a try, and i know i'll be back here.

UmXigDolSdqF0q3ETP8xaA.review_text: Gourmet breakfast at its best. very well priced. Love that there's very professional chefs , and the kitchen is behind the counterand you can actually watch her food being made.  Food is very very good!! And morning cocktails are very well made . Gourmet all the way and not too expensive. Quality food

sRVGewx--HgwwlKwAfCO9Q.review_text: First things first, this is not RNM, so you can throw those expectations out the window. (I know, I cried too).  This is a new day and a new place.  It's a "no reservations" kind of place, so if you get there at prime time, be prepared to wait.   The decor has been updated to a modern organic type of feel, with a vertical plant feature right above the bar.    I would venture to say that it's worth the wait (although I hate to wait) because the food and the drinks are done with care and craftsmanship.  The cocktails are creative and the small share plates are very good for the most part.  My favorites were the duck sliders, calamari, char, and the fries with the delicious olive aioli.  I wasn't as crazy about the deconstructed tart or the crudo.  All of the cocktails were very good, with the 5 Spot being my favorite.  Go very early or late night, and you should be able to get a seat right away - that's how I'd do it.

f-0RttyJU3Tu-QfcqrbC_A.review_text: Finally! A stylish (but comfortable) place in Lower Haight to get crafty cocktails paired with great food. I've been waiting for Maven to open for awhile now since RNM has left the place dark and empty. Loving the living wall of lush, green plants and beautiful redwood tables.  Service was on point. Food and drinks came out on time, and the servers knew what they were talking about. They've got a host/waiting list now, so getting seated was a non-issue. Staff was great - Jordan was great to talk to and very attentive.  My favorite drinks: Global Warming- gin, sake, lemon, and absinthe sorbet melting in it. So good! New Boy Valentine is a nice, smooth darker rum cocktail if you're looking for one. "Nauti' Mermaid" is my favorite name for a drink ;)  Favorite food? the Savory Winter Tart- I've never seen a mushroom tart like this before, but it's amazing! Perfectly cooked mushrooms served on top of delicious housemade ricotta. Chinatown duck sliders are a must also- shitake mushrooms, greens, bacon, and duck in Hoisin sauce. I'm Chinese, and yes, I still thought this dish was legit.  Overall, a great place to bring your friends for quality food and drinks any night of the week. I can't wait for them to begin serving brunch!  Tips: a) Sit by the kitchen counter and watch them cook everything up or b) Walk upstairs to the mezzanine and get a view from up top by the fireplace.

PcFnbGXcQkst3tF6B5rJdQ.review_text: I went here for cocktails and was thoroughly impressed. Well balanced cocktails where you can actually taste and savor the main alcohol used. Inventive, unique, and dangerously good. It's basically impossible to stop at one. Try the Global Warming.

cmKsgwaPIe4N9fM3JvdR2w.review_text: Well this place was a great find. A buzzing yet cozy place we went to in a group for a birthday celebration.  The service was truly top notch, even excitedly telling us about their brunch service when we enquired how many other meals of the day we can get this food and service.  In a group it can be hard to organize a table but the waiter was fantastic, suggesting how much we should order and how many per table, and pointing out a few must haves. For me the must haves were the Pickles, Chicken and Brussels Sprouts ( only the second time I've enjoyed them in my life).  It's just great to be in a place where the staff are proud of their work and want you to enjoy yourself. An open kitchen is an added bonus of being close to the action and knowing what is going on.  Get your person there!

3SZCT6klYdI81TQrOJOcHA.review_text: i would like give 3.5 stars to this restaurant.. but..  they serve some tasteful dishes.. we tried about 5 tonight. overall, i felt the dishes were a bit highly priced for what it was. the portion was generally small and couldn't see. but normally for this kind of restaurant, i would give 4 instead of 3..  the reason i'm giving 3 stars is that they totally messed up the pork belly! their pork loin was cooked perfectly.. juicy, tender and.. just awesome. then the pork belly was so overcooked, it was actually hard to chew.   duck sliders, oysters, scallop crudo and drinks were decent, nothing spectacular though.

btvNDnUStJfOJ0LraNIrdg.review_text: great place all around .. I went for burgers and drinks with a friend .. the bartender was really nice and helped us choose some good bourbon  love the burger !! the house made chips w curry that come w it are amazing as well

j-3RH-1CV-BBKL-rJ12k0w.review_text: I have been looking forward to Mavens opening for a long time.  The idea of a menu paired with cocktails is genius!  The ambiance of the place is super swank but simple and open. It's pretty busy but I never felt cramped or got bumped, and THANK YOU Maven for creating a good cocktail bar where you can get a drink right away and the bartenders are happy to see you.  Just that alone makes this my new favorite drink spot! The staff is SUPER knowledgeable but not arrogant.  I loved, loved the Mr. Wiggles, which is Mavens Manhattan.  So good.  ...and, umm, juniper fries? YES PLEASE.  These guys GET IT! Nice work Maven, I will be back!

o60yRcNLuy-oIjHfNlAEdA.review_text: Came here late on a Saturday... wanted some food w/ our drinks and their kitchen is open late.  The problem is their food selection is kind of weak... looking at the menu, we were drawn to the duck sliders, but they were out of that... so we got some fries, the cheese plate, and the calamari.... fries were on a small plate..... not sure if the olive aioli works.... the calamari was very small... there's some sauteed pieces on the bottom and some fried pieces on top, but not that much of it.  It was tasty tho.  The cheese plate was good... all tasty cheeses... but could have used more substantial bread.  The pieces we got were quite holey.    But the drinks were fantastic!  I got the Hometown Vixen... wow.. great cocktail!  Friends got some other ones that were tasty as well.  Bartender was very nice and helpful and service overall was great.  A clean place overall.... bathroom was clean... It is very loud in there, even at 1/2 full.... but I'd like to come back and just drink continuously.

nmt15twJ_mWvC5brJpswPw.review_text: FINALLY - restaurant/bar owners that get it!!!! Decor, food, and drinks are ALL special and important here. I love that the owners at Maven didn't skimp on the small details, it's a total class act while still being low key. This is one of a few places that would actually translate and survive in NYC or Philadelphia. Oh, and the waiters know their sh*t when it comes to the food and the cocktails which is equally important.  Gorgeous redwood tables, a living wall above the bar, and candlelight ambiance - what's not to love? The food is really sophisticated and perfect for those who want to pop in, have a nice cocktail, and share some snacks with friends.  We had the butternut agnolotti (tossed with a divine brussel sprout slaw), the calamari (spicy, a mix of breaded and unbreaded), and braised fennel and watercress with buratta and roasted tomatoes. Yum! The chef really took the food here to another level, which I appreciate. It's creative, delicious, and there are many relatively healthy options which is rare at most bars.  Cocktails, beer, and wine were on point. The draft beers were served ice cold, which is something I'm very particular about and also appreciated.   It's nice to see such a sophisticated space in a residential neighborhood for once in San Francisco. Normally you have to go downtown to hang out somewhere this chic - so am LOVING the fact that this bastion of sophistication is raising the bar in the Lower Haight!

wYvnUZdVGlHI4fY3i1WDyA.review_text: Love Maven!  Came here on a Friday night for a date night. Maven's trendy yet romantic ambiance was perfect.  1st plate: Oysters on the Half Shell - Fresh, cool and invigorating 2nd plate: Duck Sliders - Juicy, full of flavor, awesome 3rd plate - Roasted Suckling Pig - Interesting flavors, fun & unique plate   Our server was friendly & knowledgeable.  Tip: Sit on the 2nd floor if you can! Great view + couches = win.

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: it's been a while since i've found a restaurant that i wouldn't mind coming back to the very next day until i found maven.  we'd originally been planning on going to rickybobby, but rickybobby = under maintenance.   maven seems SLIGHTLY out of place in lower haight.  it's beautiful / modern inside and screams yuppie.  you'd think that you were at happy hour in the financial district or south beach / soma.  but that's where i live, so... that's why it's up my alley.  in any case, get the maven burger!!  i love a good burger, and maven provides just that.  not only does it look and taste good, but they serve it in halves so that your burger doesn't fall all over the place.  it was perfect for my friend and i because we could share + try more items on the menu.  duck sliders = also amazing.  again, they taste as good as they look in the pictures.  kind of asiany, so if you're not into that, don't get it.  it's definitely worth tasting, though.  if you share this plate with the maven burger, you'll have a solid meal.    fries were also perrrfectly salted.  i'm talking mcdonald's status-salty, but bigger!  finally... their menu is arranged in a grid format so that you can see exactly what cocktail / beer / wine pairs well with what you've ordered.  i had some type of amber ale that was supposed to go with the duck sliders that i'd order again.

1d8in7BXvgFUey6ZjDTn0A.review_text: At Maven during day 2 after opening.  The space has really been transformed since RNM; more industrial and communal.  The living wall of plants over the bar is a nice change.  We tried 6 of the cocktails on the seasonal menu, and they were all imminently drinkable.  Kudos on the delicious egg white drinks on the menu, Santa's Cookies and Three Little Birds.

oMI7eaE2DYfNKpk1CU7spA.review_text: Came here for 7x7s big eats item: Chinatown duck sliders. They were delicious. The meat cooked perfectly, not too dry and not overpowered with seasoning, but the right amount of broth for the sandwich. The bread was soft and a bit sweet- lightly toasted and paired perfectly with the duck's flavors.  We sat at the top bar- which provides an excellent view of the restaurant and the street below- plenty of people watching and an intimate experience all in the same.   Excellent drinks and great service. Stop waiting, just go.

AmPBjcdEV2lzLlK4RL2Baw.review_text: Went to Maven on Friday night, two days after it opened.  The place was packed and the front did look a bit disorganized, but our friend got there a few minutes before us and was able to get a table for our party.  Service was attentive and friendly, drinks were great, food was fantastic.  My favorite was the deconstructed mushroom tart (awesome concept, delicious execution).  Everything else we ordered was just as quality.  Also really liked the ambiance and decor - you could tell a lot of thought and effort went into creating the vibe.  Reading the other reviews, it looks like they probably should work something different out for the front of the house, but based on my first visit, I have zero complaints.  Looking forward to when they start serving brunch!

C9SioHCD9l6g0ua0NdoVBA.review_text: This is really a 3.5 star place.  I like this place because it is the bar/restaurant combo.  Every seat is a communal table, and the place is very focused on the libations, but the food is also good.  Monk's kettle and Alembic also fit the bar/restaurant combo place, but the food at those places left a lot to be desired.  The food at bar agricole and nopa is very nice, but those places seem more like borderline fancy restaurants than casual bar/restaurants. Places like Romolo seem more like bars with food than restaurant/bar combos.    I have to admit it.  I am old man now.  I've been married for 5 years and have a young baby.  Clubs fell off 4 years ago, and now pure bars are slowly slipping away.  My 'bars' and nightlife are boiling down to places like Maven where I combine dinner and drinks.   Maven is a place that fills a hole in the SF nightlight/dining scene, and is the perfect place for me now.  The drinks are very good.  The food is hit or miss.  I had some wonderful calamari and kampachi crudo dishes.  I also had a salad and pasta dish that were very forgettable, if not down right bad.    I would certainly go back again for drinks and food, but I will order more carefully.

ORYu-cLe0SxineXThaNuYA.review_text: Definitely a great spot on haight! Good vibes and super friendly staff. Grilled cheese is to die for. Mussels were good too (but there were a few that were a bit fishy). Love that they have drink pairings with all their main dishes!!

5wlHRbDGQ8shSqiaQK9NrQ.review_text: Great cocktails to start. Unique flavors and the bartender mixes them up fast.  I had the Hometown Vixen (Bourbon, Pistachio, Orange and Black Pepper) it was the best coctail I've had in a long time.  ::  The chilled strawberry soup was refreshing and delicious.  The server pours it out of a white pitcher over a nice piece of buratta.    ::  The trout was the star of the show. A plate of rainbow colored veggies delicately plated with a beautiful tender piece of crispy skinned trout on top was amazing. Cooked perfectly!  I will return for sure.  PS - they do not take reservations therefore they will not seat you until your entire party has arrived. OK by me, they had an amazing bar!

PEU1ayT7WFqHS4wJ-_BqNQ.review_text: Met up with RL after yoga.  Cool space.  Limited menu.  Standout: duck slider.

sinLZcwqvXAYLGM2aKHVcw.review_text: What an experience.  It's hard to stick out as "something different" in SF, and this place shouts "unique".  The cocktail pairings with the food go together flawlessly, the food is top notch, and the atmosphere is fantastic.  I came in a party of 4 with no reservation on a Friday night at 8pm...sat us down no wait!  2 $$ is a bit of an understatement, the size of the portions are not terribly big so expect Maven to cost more like a $$$ yelp place, but believe me its worth it.  Have fun

FtGEpYCF6DYwiBL4zFMfRA.review_text: Stopped by here after work for drinks with friends one evening. I got some small food items that were tasty, but a smidge overpriced, even for the area. But the drinks were good, and the service reasonably prompt for a crowded Friday night.  I may return for a real meal at some point.

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: Girl dates. It's absolutely essential. It gives you a chance to gloat about the Prince Charming you have in your life (or bitch about the one you don't have), vent about the blind date from hell that picked you up on his tricycle or embarrassingly reveal the random bar hookup with the Mr. Ron Jeremy's doppelganger that you later find out works in your IT department. Eeeck. No wonder Patti Stanger always preaches the "2 drink max" rule. My childhood BFF and I were due for a girl date. We both had Maven bookmarked which made our a place for date night an easy choice. Immediately upon walking in, we both realized that Maven was in the old RNM space. The once sultry dark hot date restaurant is now a stunning industrially sleek venue that's good for catching up over killer artisan cocktails, casual dates, and small group dinners. Sit downstairs at the communal tables where all the action is at or upstairs for a more intimate dinner while overseeing the action below. Come early because they do not accept reservations. The first of its kind (that's I've seen), Maven has a menu that's pairs a cocktail with an adjacent food item and a beer or wine pairing. There's just 10 items on the menu (5 apps, 3 entrees & 2 desserts) and 6 bar bites so choose wisely because the bill can easily rack up if you do all the pairings. I'm not big on alcohol pairings and rather order what's sounds most appealing to me so I ordered THE cocktail that all the Yelpers recommended: The Global Warming ($11). It was super refreshing and the absinthe sorbet made me glow after several sips so beware: bit.ly/11mwaH4. This cocktail is not for one shot wonders. The cocktails are the winner at Maven so don't come without ordering one. Go elsewhere for dinner... The food at Maven was nothing spectacular nor worth going back for especially with the high prices points and small portions. The House Made Charcuterie Plate ($16) was not appetizing especially with the burnt toast points: bit.ly/108XSFL. I never met a pate or terrine I didn't love until I met this charcuterie plate. I couldn't put my finger on it other than the textures were just off. The Salmon Crudo ($10) was like a rich deviled potato with a silky spiral of lox: bit.ly/14NLgIQ. Super yummy! The Duck Sliders ($9 for two) were mouthwatering and packed with a delicious savoryness but not very Chinesey as it didn't have any crispy duck skin: bit.ly/Z8udsS. It was more like a pulled duck confit slider but nonetheless solid. The Suckling Pig ($25) was a huge disappointment on a small platter (more tapas sized than an entree) as it didn't have the quintessential crackling skin which is what makes suckling pig "suckling"; rather it was several thin slices of pork loin, one pork rib and one pork croquette: bit.ly/Z8umfZ. Don't get me wrong, the pork trio was nicely cooked but the name on the menu was misleading. We opted out of dessert and decided to end our girl date in true SF fashion...with a shot of Fernet. They arrived in the cutest bootie shot glasses: bit.ly/XdK9NN. If I was a klepto I would have totally took these home with me. In the beginning, the staff was attentive, friendly and down-to-earth. As it got busy, the attentiveness wore down significantly and food service was very slow. Our shared entree took close to an hour to arrive after our last app was done. It was also very hard to find our waiter as the night progressed so we had to flag down another waiter just to get our water refilled and pay our bill. By the way, this was a Tuesday night. After said and done, $65 a person for two drinks, one unappetizing charcuterie, two pieces of sashimi, one slider and several bites of pork is pricey. Either that or my Asian CheapAssGene has finally made its appearance. My Chinesey momma would be proud! Now excuse me while I hoard ketchup packets from McD.

vi1Ta_3XtGTqkl4p83ZbEQ.review_text: Maven has a great space (shout out to the Living Wall) and good cocktails, but the food leaves something to be desired in both taste and portion.  For $30, I had one cocktail (The Global Warming which was refreshing), scallop crudo and 2 duck sliders.  I realize it's small plates/tapas but was still surprised by the small portions.  For now, I'll stick to just coming back for drinks.

n742Fsnf370jEyGL5yvP7Q.review_text: Excellent cocktails & fine dining at casual prices. Sit at the chef's table and watch the artistes behind the counter work their magic. This is our go-to for date night in the 'hood (and now, brunch too!). Love it, hope it stays undiscovered!

hq_Gn9HpPas-S53F5jaF1w.review_text: So disappointed after the good reviews. Ordered Brussel sprouts - good Sardines - sardines themselves were tasty but I wasn't a fan of the accompanying salad, although my fiancé thought it was okay Oysters - oysters themselves were large and juicy, but in a weird, salty, miso soup tasting flavored sauce that ruined them. Gnocchi - a weird concoction of vegetables and potato with a sauce that seemed mismatched and did nothing to enhance this bland dish. Fudgcicle desert - okay. Coffee Ginger beer - good $81 pre-tip Service - pleasant, friendly waiter

iXXyxld-01zCuOzDDTowZg.review_text: I can't say enough good things about Maven in SF. Last night's small plate tasting menu with paired cocktails was simply superb. Kate, our bartender, was full of information about what she was mixing us, and even gave us tastes of the individual ingredients so that we could better understand where the flavors were coming from. The quality of what is served and the care with which it is served might just be unmatched. We saw one cocktail get tasted four times by two different bartenders (using the straw trick, of course) and adjusted once before serving. The cocktail ingredients are all top shelf or home made (syrups, infusions). The food is spectacular (fresh ingredients prepared with care). The design of the venue is modern and elegant but warm and comfortable. Yes, the drinks and dishes are pricey, but you get every penny's worth and more. 4 courses paired with 4 drinks, shared, makes a very pleasant light dinner for two and will run you about $100. Go to Maven on your next date night. And tell your friends.

MtV_ehFusGwykpvlaKD-uQ.review_text: This has become a go to place for me, the service is always outstanding, friendly and really interested in you enjoying yourself.  I went last night with a girlfriend for the bloomspot 4-course with cocktails for two.  We were treated special and with excitement for us to try this fun pairing.  The food was AMAZING, so well paired with the fun drinks, had a great Holiday feel to it and again service was top notch.  Love Love Love this place.

bZPvLuiGu9Cq_WFQ2_rdlQ.review_text: I want to LOVE this place. It is really good but I will continue my hunt for my perfect neighborhood bar. My friends and I stumbled in after dinner down the street. The vibe and decor is fantastic -- chic and well-designed. The menu is fantastically entertaining with creative small plates each paired with a suggested cocktail and glass of wine. We had some good cocktails but none that I would order twice. I'd love to see a few more cocktails (maybe something with cucumber or ginger).   I was hoping this could be my go-to date location but it was very loud and my friends and I were yelling at each other all night :)  Overall, a fun spot for friends but not for great conversation.

HxeF2A4CTQNzWcPx-Qdsdg.review_text: Very hip place, although kind of too hip for haight ashbury since I'm really used to going to dive bars and pizza joints in this area. The cocktails are amazing though! I had the "Global Warming" and the "Let it Bee."  Both were really good. My friend had the "5 Spice" and the "Ransom Note." The 5 Spice was kind of a weird mix of flavors but definitely good. For a light dinner we had the duck sliders which had light sesame buns and were light on sauce but very rich flavors. We also got an order of fries which were way too salty. After that tiny dinner and two drinks each the bill came out to $30 per person, I woud save this place for a special occasion. Definitely a cool spot though, I would go back!

b_gVqX6Wi7HwsRT8aCzcQw.review_text: Right next to my house. The staff is super friendly and they have a very cozy upstairs lounge area with a fire place.  All the cocktails are amazing my fav is the 5-Spot.  Their menu always changes which I like.   Great date spot or to grab a drink. The burger is to die for and the best thing on the menu!! AMAZING   The olives are great when your drinking and waiting for a table. They also have a seating where you can watch them prepare the food. SOO FUN the bartenders are soooo nice all of them.

yb3hnYT5VUT7ZgdcYonzTw.review_text: The bartenders are nice and the service is great. I had the duck sliders and fries which was delicious.  The menu is a bit small (which can be good bc it makes it easier to choose), for me i wish i had a bit more food variety. BUT my experience at Maven was great and I am very happy with the resto!

ZjkYO-869slCiI0Za7_4Vg.review_text: This place is one of the best cocktail/small bites places I've found in a LOOOONG time.  It was a recommendation from a very chic friend... we sat in the couches next to the fireplace in the upstairs section.  The service was fantastic, attentive but not pushy, friendly, and helpful with advice on pairings.   The cocktails were absolutely lovely-  great flavors, none of which tasted of alcohol (dangerous, but refreshing), and complimented the palate with the dishes. I started off with Global Warming, which was a stunning piece of creative mixology (including an absinthe sorbet that melted into the drink while you sipped it), then journeyed onto the 5 Spot.  We ate tapas style, sharing the duck sliders.  Now, let me be clear, I HATE duck. Despise it-- greasy, gamey, overall just ick.  However, this place, this dish, has converted me (or at least in that I will ONLY eat duck at Maven). I was also in culinary heaven with their jalapeno garnished sashimi and their grilled, then flash fried calamari-  light, not oily, not breaded (that I remember).  The decor is chic, elegant and welcoming-- with its upstairs lounge area like the "no-kids allowed" den you've always wanted in your home. The place is just amazing-- go.

tfTuFG9tZgnd2loShX2-0A.review_text: Was in town for the long weekend and wanted to try a tapas bar. I was very happy to find Maven. My family and I had the duck sliders (which were incredible!), gnocchi, the amazing brussel sprouts and a winter soup which consisted of butternut squash poured over a combination of coco granola and root beer marshmallow. Sounds a little crazy but so delicious! Great vibe as well. I will definitely stop back here next time I'm in SF.

3G9Jkn7hKc8fmbdK8_lC8g.review_text: this is a really great place to hang out with a friend. share a couple of small plates and indulge in some crafty cocktails. i particularly liked the Avalanche cocktail. it was lime-ish minty goodness with just a bit of froth from whipped egg whites. light and refreshing, a drink i could have over and over again. and this is surprising considering i am not a fan of the taste of alcohol in any way.

PMV_KKQ8HmiCLD-1SYJ6RA.review_text: The duck sliders were killer! If you don't eat duck cause of the game taste in the meat (like me) and i am saying their killer. These are well worth it! Inside was well designed with a modern vertical garden above the bar.

6PTSR6DSpoXV02cEqimS9A.review_text: Maven is definitely going to become the next go to hot spot in lower Haight.  Maven has a hip urban vibe with beautiful redwood bars and tables, completely open kitchen, and living wall above the bar.  I highly recommend the upstairs lounge where you can sip your cocktail by the fire or people watch from the upstairs bar.   Most restaurants focus on quantity over quality.  Maven is all about an amazing dish paired with the perfect wine or cocktail.  The one page menu takes all the guesswork out by suggesting pairings for food and drinks.  You have to try Santa's Cookies pared with the Butternut Squash Agnolotti (one of several vegetarian friendly dishes).  Global warming (for fellow gin lovers) and the Scallop Crudo is another winner.    If cocktails are not your thing the Grenache I tried was great too.

4W1D-dUW7bC_CJYgslzUqA.review_text: Good burgers, good drinks, good service.

jC5AmzkXDYxdxbosStlo7g.review_text: One of my favorite restaurants in all of the culinary mecca, that is San Francisco. Love everything about this place, from the decor, to the food and on point drink pairings. They also change up their menu often, according to what's fresh and in season. The seating is communal, long pretty wooden tables, lined with stools, so it gives you a chance to rub elbows, maybe make some new friends, and most importantly oogle at other people's food if you are milking your first cocktail and still can't decide what to order.   My #1 burger in all the city. They just do it right! From the homemade chips, to the juicy patty, and fresh homemade bun, it's everything you need in a burger. I was appalled by a review I once read, hating on this burger, this person obviously grew up hitting the $1 menu at McDonalds and never acquired a true palate for quality beef. The freezer burned patties effed up their tastebuds for sure. Anyways, haters gonna hate, and I am gonna continue loving this burger forever. Love you Maven!  The brunch is also delicious, but expect a wait on wknds.

E5u_KcfZDHdRrKTgIUhxSw.review_text: I went to Maven last Thursday, the day after it opened to the public so I understand that things may have not been running as smoothly as they will once the restaurant and its staff has time to get it/their bearings.   The trouble started when we first walked in. Though we were seated fairly promptly, we were left for 20 minutes without so much as a menu to look at. Once we got the menu and waited another 10 minutes for our waiter to ask us what we wanted, we learned that our two top choices (duck sliders and the calamari) for food were unavailable. Not a huge deal, but still something that should be mentioned once menus are handed out.   My two guests and I settled on the kenebec fries, the burger and the tart. The tart, for starters, is actually a deconstructed tart, which was a bit off putting. Still, the taste was satisfactory and the ability to pick and choose what to include in each bite was cool. The burger, on the other hand, was entirely too salty. I'm talking INSANELY salty. The fries were, well, fries.   We were still hungry after our two burgers, fries and tart, so we ordered the charcuterie plate, which turned out to be nothing of the sort. When I hear "charcuterie" I think of thinly sliced salted cured meats. Instead what we got was chicken liver, rabbit in some sort of puree and a third meat that I'm forgetting. None of the three were described in any sort of detail on the menu so we had no way to know wat we were getting.   The one saving grace of the night was the drinks, which were very good. I had two sazeracs as well as a manhattan, and all three were fantastic. I really hope this place gets its act together and makes some needed changes to the menu as we've been waiting for a good replacement to the underwhelming RNM for some time.  Good luck, Maven.

LKpd28drREu-cHwflED0TQ.review_text: Small plates and cocktails. Lots of pairing which is cool. The interior is super nice. All appear to be creations of the chef, cool joint.

bZoQUItyOXFwnztcFeLkkA.review_text: WTF... I've been here before and it was F--KING amazing, so to say I was disappointed by my latest trip would be an understatement.   What happened?  This place seems very different to me, from the menu to the wine list.  The menu selection seems smaller than it had been and many of the items that I had really didn't work. I started with the salmon crudo, which was passable, but nothing terribly memorable about it other than the overall flavor was that of potato and not of the salmon.  Second dish was the stone fruit salad, which was accompanied with lettuces, almonds, a selection fruits and smoked paprika in a vinaigrette.  That all sounds great but for the life of me I couldn't find any smoked paprika anywhere and believe me I looked! Next was the calamari with a Thai Chili sauce with ginger and cardamom.  This was terrible.  Sorry for the bluntness but I only choked down a few pieces before I gave up.  The tentacles were hard fried to the point of being unrecognizable and they tasted of old or stale oil.  The "bodies" needed to be cleaned better and the sauce that they were accompanied with didn't help bring anything together on this dish (and made me burp all night long).  I was surprised when the server took it that I wasn't asked why I was not finishing it.  Lastly was the burger with fires.  I will say the burger was cooked perfectly and tasted fine, a little messy but good, the fires on the other hand were not edible.  They were cooked horribly and tasted like that.  More than half of the order was burnt to a crisp while the other half tasted old and stale.  And the salt... I love salt, I have 6 kinds of salt in my house, but these were covered in salt to the point that I was brushing off the fries in an attempt to eat them.    A quick word on the service tonight:  below par.  When the server finally came and took the order, she wasn't ready for me to give her my order.  She was shocked that I was ready; I mean I had only been sitting there for like 15-20 minutes...  The when the food came, it was generally plopped down in front of me.  Never was there a change of plates of silverware even though I was having fish first then other courses to follow.  Poor showing, very poor showing.  I see by the reviews that this must be on out of ordinary experience, and in their defense, the times that I have been here before, have been excellent, so I don't know what happened tonight, but buyer beware.  Good luck.

peru1M80PyPsYt5kqmTfAA.review_text: Service, staff, location, food, drinks.... 1. The service is attentive, impeccable and friendly.  The customer (you) come first.  I used to secret shop restaurants and I am therefore hard to please, but my waiter last night was perfect.  My guest ordered calamari but doesn't like seafood (last time I eat with this guest) so he asked to send back the calamari and have it all deep fried.  Originally, some it if was deep fried and some of it was fresh - I prefer fresh.  The waiter took our calamari and came back in a few minutes with the deep fried version, no questions asked.  The waiter brought the food out in a timely fashion and while the food was at it's perfect temperature.  My burger was just right.  It was on a rather small plate, but delicious. 2. Staff - the manager was there and brought our glasses of wine over.   He asked how we were doing and that added a personal touch  to the night.  I must note that the wine selection, while not extensive, was just right.  There are enough wines by the glass to satisfy everyone with an addition of an unknown for the wine enthusiast. 3. Location - Although I hate to drive in a city that is only 7X7, there were open parking spots everywhere.  I came from my office in SOMA and it was very close.  I like that it wasn't in the Mission, but a little closer to the NOPA, Hayes and the Castro.  It is a great location if you are meeting friends from all over the city.  I was also surprised that I had never been in the area and at how many shops there were that looked interesting.  4. Food - The menu is simple and it keeps the focus on your experience.  There is a good variety of things to choose from.  I love to try new restaurants in SF, but I look for fresh, local ingredients and a flavorful zest - something new.  Maven added a twist on the burger by adding Munster cheese.  Burgers are all the rage these days and this one is bound to pique your pallets interest.  The calamari I describe above was lightly garnished in a zesty sauce, not too heavy.  I will have to go back and try the skirt steak and the sliders...and the Winter Tart!  The Mayan Chocolate was superb with a hint of orange zest.   5. Drinks - They have yellow chartreuse on the menu, bitters and all the fixings a mixologist would need.  Timeless, trendy....but oh so divine!

rsW5CeBtf7pSkZFfrlFUgg.review_text: This place was pretty popp'n at 1130pm on a Thursday night. There seemed to be more white collared couples here than groups of people. There was a romantic ambiance to Maven's which gave off a good vibe. Being a single guy, it was a different experience and I was more into the food than anything else. That's why we're here! lol   Party of 4 and here's what we ordered a few drinks,  the Chinatown Duck Sliders,  Kampachi Sashimi,  Autumn Chestnut Ravioli,  Monterey Calamari, and Chocolate Mousse Napoleon.   Sounds like almost like a dinner for two no? It was well worth it and the price we paid was decent too.   FOOD: Delish, creative presentation, comforting.  Service: Attentive, friendly and open to suggestions. I would come here again with friends or for a date. ;)

buq2WXRpx2fn2NUb82h8QA.review_text: Cute restaurant. Mixed drinks were decent. Food was ok as well but not memorable.  Felt the price was a bit steep for this neighborhood.  Would I go out of my way to return?  No. If friends wanted to meet up here would I join them? Yes.

fSR_UX9kSeU4oOkrP4zacg.review_text: Maven your delicious food has convinced that you deserve four stars. But based on the wait and the service, it would have been one.   When I entered Maven at 9pm, there was only 1 couple ahead of us with a quoted 30 minute wait. An hour later, I am hungry and slightly irritated that four couples were seating ahead. Plus, I see open seating interspersed throughout the restaurant while I am standing in a corner, stomach growling. But sitting in front of the kitchen, watching the chef's cook completely made up for the wait.   Ordered the potato gnocchi, Rocky's chicken, Chinatown duck sliders, and Maven burger. Orders came out fast and the portions were decent. Truthfully, I feel like the portion I received was bigger than the ones going out to the tables. Food did not disappoint. I was mainly excited for the burger but the other dishes surprised me - all were very flavorful, not overly salty, and had me wanting more. Watching the chefs really made me appreciate their ability to multi-task. The girlfriend also really enjoyed the food and has asked me multiple times to return.  What I recommend: - Chinatown duck sliders - Maven burger

885vzJbgGnm9evb-nQDu_Q.review_text: Great bar. Love the decor. Good service. Drinks are a hit or miss unless you know exactly what you want. I ordered something off the menu which was alright but I asked for a replacement and requested a Mojito. It was fantastic and one of the better ones I've had.

j0huDycECykRSXpe2i_6_Q.review_text: I just loved this place. Five stars for ambience, service, and food.   In terms of food, duck sliders were delicious, and the gnocchi was great too (had tons of veggies including artichokes).   The drinks are fun. I had such a great time here and can't wait to go back!!

XXi_Q7XMI7I9iqfXi_W42w.review_text: YES! I have been waiting for Maven to open. This place is great. Just what Lower Haight needed... somewhere very swanky, gourmet food and a nice place to bring a date.  The beer and wine selection is superb for the price. Hard liquor is also available (thank goodness they have their full liquor license unlike several bars in the area). The small plates are delicious. The waiters are friendly and knowledgeable. The ambiance is sexy.  The comprehensive menu of small plates suggests a wine or beer to go with each. It's presented in a grid style. What a creative idea!   However, a few improvement suggestions: More seating downstairs. They have four long tables which take up a lot of room and force you to sit right next to the people next to you. A bit awkward. I bet they could fit more people in and give them a sense of personal space with smaller, individual tables.  They need a few more entrée / dinner items around $10 - $15. The only thing they offer at this price that is suited for dinner is a burger (which is a fabulously delicious medley of flavors... hard to imagine for a burger). But, to keep people coming back, a few more dinner items are essential. I am sure the two $25-$30 dinner options are delicious, but that is a quite pricey for this neighborhood.  Nevertheless, I love this new place. I will be sure to return many times.

LmjisX3BQ4GQMP5obmqgjA.review_text: Great high-ceilinged space made up of communal tables and limited balcony seating for people watching.  Good cocktails that don't take an eternity to wait for like other places.  Menu is set up to pair the cocktail or beer/wine with the somewhat limited food.  However, the prices are very expensive relative to this neighborhood and the food.  Hope it's sustainable or they adapt to a price point that will give them longevity.  Overall a nice addition to lower haight and good place to meet up for drinks (as long as your friends make good money!)

V7_Q1DPcAsfwFPuV1aiVPQ.review_text: I got the duck sliders and it was pretty good.   More on the sweet side than savory.  My friend got the grilled cheese and seemed to really like it.  The fries were great.  I would recommend this place for sure.  Pretty relaxing, chill environment.  Service was pretty good.

8O8dm8d5KMaUDxbSUhmPaQ.review_text: Came here for dinner on a Friday night and only had to wait 15 minutes for a table.  Great drink menu - I had to try the Global Warming (aged gin, sake, riesling, lemon, absinthe sorbet).  There was an actual scoop of absinthe sorbet in the drink that melted as I sipped, changing the flavor of the drink slightly as I got closer to the bottom.  Food was delicious as well.  They have a completely open kitchen, so we were able to watch the chefs at work carefully constructing each dish.  We ordered the calamari, maven burger (husband claims it's the best burger he's ever had) and the salmon crudo.  Also had the chocolate mousse napoleon which was out of this world.  The atmosphere was hip but unpretentious and the servers were extremely attentive and friendly.  I'd definitely recommend this place if you're in the neighborhood looking for great meal with little fuss.

as9kh0CBsg1i1JuTIqTqFg.review_text: I remember when this restaurant first opened and I was working for Yelp I tried to call them to advertise....alas they did not need to and I chalked it up to a cult following, not my sales skills.   Anywho....at the time I read the reviews (both Yelp and SF Gate) and thought "man....I WANT to try this place out!"  It sounded amazing.  So a few years later I finally got around to making it to Maven with a few girlfriends for my birthday.  The drinks are phenomenal, and the food is quite delicious.  The atmosphere is casual but chic and fun, and I loved the upstairs area.  The wait staff, though hipster, wasn't annoying which I appreciate.  I'll go here again!  Super fun and yummy!

sGYrxVCEJGGBArWI1LUgxQ.review_text: Small plates but since every bite is a perfect bite, you will not be disappointed.  I had the Dungeness crab - lump crabmeat with chunks of creamy avocado and roasted and grilled sweet corn with a sprinkling of pimenton pepper (like cayenne but smoky-tasting). The dish is a taste sensation.   (I debated licking the plate or kissing the chef)  With all the chatter about the Chinatown duck sliders, I had to order them and they were undeniably delicious with shredded duck seasoned with five-spice mix, hoisin sauce and black mushrooms.   I took the bartender's pairing suggestion and had the La Coartada cocktail with the Dungeness crab and the 5-Spot just-right smoky/spicy cocktail with the duck sliders.   Since the sliders took some time coming out of the kitchen as Maven was by then hoppin' I also had a glass of a very jammy, delicious Downhill Cabernet Sauvignon.  It was a very perfect experience and I plan to be back soon for the "insider-ly" and off-menu "Mr. Wiggles" cocktail.   Since the bar and restaurant were nicely populated even for a Monday night, I can see how this new & trendy spot would get very busy on Friday and Saturday nights.

b4E3th5wQd_7TNw6Yw2rXg.review_text: I went here a couple weeks ago with my burger club really excited to try the burgs. I had been before for cocktails and small plates but had read great things.   Unfortunately, while the service was great, the drinks strong, and the ambience lovely (thus the 3 stars), the burgers themselves missed the mark. Several of us ordered medium-rare burgers and several ordered medium, but all our burgers came out the same inside: brown. McDonalds hamburger patty brown. It was a shame because the fixings were absolutely delicious - great cheese, sauce, sautéed onions, etc. and I am sure the meat would have been tasty had it retained some juices during its scorching.   I am sure I will be back for drinks and small plates but the burger club will not be making a repeat visit.  Anytime I splurge over $10 on a burg in SF would hope for it to be made to order.

3MW4brnDaAJiW8kvRlzc2A.review_text: Absolutely the worst meal I've had this year bar none. Outside of a very cold burger and an arctic char with no seasoning whatsoever, the real low point of this meal were the potatoes that accompanied my fish. They literally tasted like they were marinated in liquid smoke and served raw. Absolutely disgusting. This chef should be embarrassed for taking peoples money.  After 90 bucks, a couple of uneaten plates and some overpriced drinks (10 bucks for a 5oz pour of Unti Rose, which only costs them $13 a bottle!) we went out and had another dinner after this meal.

UN12gmj43lpEtrzk9SSG3Q.review_text: Got a table fairly quickly on a busy Sunday night. Brussels were delicious. Our server brought extras in a flash when we ran out of bread for the cheese plate or dip for the fries. A little difficult to hear so pass if it's busy and you're wanting an intimate conversation. Seems like the perfect place to bring a few friends to empty a few bottles of wine. We were only a party of 2 but emptied one with no trouble! ;)

swocJWD8R1iH20-lveXh0Q.review_text: Maven is totally hip with a fireplace upstairs, dining bar overlooking the restaurant and fancy moss bar.  I brought my BF here and we shared a few plates and chose the suggested wine/cocktail paring.  The scallop crudo was delicious, and so were the kumomoto oysters.  I could pass on the duck sliders and the seared artic char though.  The restaurant will probably do better as a bar/lounge since their menu seems to be drink oriented.  Service was very attentive and friendly.

bb4iEXxiYRcnzXmUvbLRjg.review_text: *a fun mixology bar, with overpriced food* #icesphere #smallportions  So after hearing many friends rave about this place, decided to go with a friend. Fantastic atmosphere, big community tables, and the lighting was just right. We got placed next to a large bay window which was perfect for people watching on the corner of Steiner and Haight.   A fantastic selection of drinks in unique combinations, moderately priced relative to other mixology type places. They did a great promo for a certain list of drinks, they would donate money to Hurricane Sandy which I thought was quite thoughtful. I tried about 3 of the drinks which were potent, uniquely flavored, and used some great rye whiskeys.   Food however, was another thing. Small portion might as well have been called 2 month old child portion. The duck sliders were good, but nothing incredibly outstanding.   All in all a great atmosphere place in a spot on location with some great drinks for happy hour. If you're looking for food though, a bit overpriced for some picking eats and I'd rather go somewhere else on Haight.

BTcZm-svYkYfiSafOx7Kpw.review_text: This place has a very trendy atmosphere. I went here for dinner and seating was "cafeteria-style". My friend and I had gone to dinner to catch up, but the loudness of the restaurant made it hard to talk. Also, the "cafeteria-style" seating was not very roomy. It was hard for us to get to our seats and the waitress to get to us.  The food (especially the duck sliders) was good, but in very small portions. I do like that they give drink/food pairing suggestions on the menu, though.

9_dHJM9z0Pn_4W8v6u4fSg.review_text: Yum. Everything I had here was pretty good. This place is pretty cute and I like the ambiance of the place. So how this place works is that they have the food items that are kind of like tapas style and each food item is paired with a cocktail as well as a beer. You don't have to match your food with your drink item, but it's kind of fun to see what would pair with what. I didn't end up matching my food and I was fine with it. My date and I enjoyed the brussels sprouts, gnocchi, chinatown sliders, calamari and this beet salad/crudo thing which I think was a special. Everything was good. LOVED the sliders, and the beet salad. If you come here, I would say don't come starving unless you want to get a bunch of stuff and pay the price.

4Q66VNCQkQkIaQb63QVi0g.review_text: Maven is a marriage of good food and wicked cocktails.  Throw in a fun ambiance and attentive service, and it's one big happy family.  The kind of place you want for a no reservation dinner or for a special occasion.    Our group of 6 came on a week night for a birthday celebration.  No problem getting seated at 7pm but the place was packed after that.  We ordered everything off the menu and shared bites.  The communal tables made it easy, we even shared with the people next to us!  The artic char and squid were among the favorites in our group but honestly, everything is solid.  The drinks were so good, we had to repeat a couple (global warming and three little birds) so we didn't make it through the extensive drinks menu.  We'll just have to come back and savor the pairings more carefully, as the concept intends.    The night is a success, the birthday girl left happy.  What more could we ask for in an evening?  Welcoming service, delicious food, creative cocktails, chic ambiance and none of the pretension and fuss that can turn a celebration into a downer.  I love Maven.  Good job Jay and Dave.

PtTZf3VF_JwSKf-rkhuvRA.review_text: 4.5 stars  Hands down, my fav new spot that we went to while back in SF for the summer (I'm originally from here, so was eager to try new places). We were fortunate to get the Bloomspot offer for 4 dishes/cocktail pairings, plus my sister and her bf tried a number of items as well.  The goods, foodwise: Summer squash tortellini, local albacore. I thought the duck sliders were just ok.  The goods, drinkwise: Improved whisper, devil's halo, 5 spot.

Jph_YiKlWPqW9USS2Ih7-A.review_text: No thanks!  Overpriced, overcrowded... did I mention overpriced?

Mrg67Yn23qjJT_lMATuZtA.review_text: Late brunch n cocktails n sunny San Francisco...love! Really good cocktails and delicious brunch. Looking forward to trying dinner.

LlZhpU7q-93Sx12rFv_E2Q.review_text: What a pleasant surprise, a little modern oasis in the grunge of the Haight!  Great atmosphere, bar, sophisticated cocktails that compliment the apps and plates on the menu.  We were there for drinks and appetizers, and really enjoyed them...essentially scraping the plate to get the very last roasted corn kernel, bits of dungeness crab and avocado puree.  Even the calamari was taken a step beyond the typical fritto misto, combining sauteed bodies with tempura fried legs over aioli.  Definite recommendation as a first stop prior to dinner, or make a meal out of small plates and appetizers.

4Ya-tjG6q2lMOOHUlwYZ7A.review_text: great date spot for a late night dinner. loved the ambiance  albacore crudo: 4 / 5 stars calamari: 4 / 5  rainbow trout: 3.5 / 5 beef brisket: 3 / 5 grapefruit granita: 5 / 5 cat's meow: 3.5 / 5

BTt05V5qB1MbBntgvXvlgg.review_text: We only enjoyed cocktails here but they were perfect! Just what were looking for. Craft cocktails and lots of choices!! Staff was super friendly too!

O-AjCTkn4DgUlku9LC8kOA.review_text: Once again I have been duped by another restaurant offering a four course taster with accompanying four cocktails via bloomspot.    After reading the many wonderful reviews here on yelp, I thought for sure Maven was going to fulfill their obligation and treat me and my friend to some wonderful tasty eats and drinks.  Also in the Yelp reviews people who purchased Maven's promotion through Bloomspot mentioned they were seated up by the chef's bar instead of being able to sit at a table with the other dining guests.  Upon entering I noticed available seating and no one waiting for the tables, however as expected, we were sat at the chef's bar ~ no big deal.  What was a big deal were the personalities (or lack thereof) of the people serving us.  First off I asked the host to bring me a menu because I had a feeling we would want to order something else outside of the tasting menu; I never got it.  Secondly, the people serving our drinks (which were really only ONE DRINK SPLIT INTO TWO SMALLER GLASSES - NICE!) didn't bother to engage in any conversation to explain what it was we were being served.    In addition to the one drink order being split into two glasses, the PORTIONS of the food was incredibly SMALL, I mean REALLY SMALL.  This really sucked for me as I saved my appetite that day so I could enjoy what I assumed would be an ample tasting - it was not.    When deciding to order from the menu, I asked the host again for a menu - he did apologize and remembered that he forgot and brought one to us immediately.  I do however feel that the hesitation to bring the menu is - everything served on the tasting menu was also listed on the regular menu with its prices also listed.  Therefore - after reviewing the menu I calculated that the promoted $100 worth of food and cocktails, was really only $65 worth of food/drink (mind you, the promotion was spend $45 and get $100), so essentially we got $20 in yukkie watered down drinks which my friend did not drink.  We were taxed on the $100 and of course, we, being the good patrons we are, tipped 20% on the $145 bill (in addition to the pre-fix we ordered Kampachi Sashimi and two glasses of the Roederer bubbles).    Needless to say, we left hungry, disappointed and completely unsatisfied with our meal/tasting; we decided we will not return based on the incredibly cold service, small portions and not so tasty drinks.    HERE ME NOW ~ I am now making this proclamation -  I will no longer purchase restaurant promotions via Bloomspot/Livingsocial/Groupon as I would rather pay for the full price of a meal and get what I want rather then think I am getting a deal through a promotion only to realize that what I actually purchased is the ole bait and switch.  8^(    oh and Businesses be warned - Living Social is currently a defendant in a lawsuit due to these bait and switch tactics (to no fault of their own) - so get with the program and honor what you promote.

ZLZzPDnOayL4Y5YGYAf4QA.review_text: A small, clunky menu that changes often. We sat at the chef bar, which of course is always amazing, seeing the skill and efficiency that goes into the prep. Awesome show in a tiny kitchen. But that was the highlight of the meal for me.   Overpriced and hit or miss with the food. The duck sliders were pretty delicious but the gnocchi and calamari (which looked amazing!) were undercooked and surprisingly bland.  The menu is structured with beverage pairing, a nice touch that demonstrates a lot of thought and can make meal choices more intriguing. The cocktails were creative with gracefully blended flavors, but not strong enough for my liking.  Overall it was painfully hip and not worth the price of a return visit.

lLfcbYGTeVxQN5Ig0ompJg.review_text: 3.5 STARS  Stopped by with Peter L & Rodney H after hitting the Urban Air Market yesterday. Since it was 4pm and a lot of nearby restaurants weren't open yet, we found Maven by doing a quick Yelp search. Ordered a bunch of small bites and cocktails.  Drinks: We ordered the whole Afternoon cocktails menu. :) -Corpse reviver #598: gin, cocchi, ginger, citrus, coriander ($11) -The original whisper: lillet, orgeat, spring vermouth, lemon, chili, smoke ($9) -5 spot: aged rhum, ginger, lime, maple, thai basil, five spice ($11) -Sparkling paloma: blanco, bubbles, lime, grapefruit ($11)  The Corpse reviver #598 was light in flavor but packed an alcoholic punch! Very refreshing and citrusy. The Sparkling paloma was a great play on a mimosa with grapefruit. I do love my bubbles! Peter got the The original whisper while Rodney had the 5 spot.  For food, we basically order the whole Afternoon bites menu except for the Cheese plate ($16) & Maven's burger ($13).  Shishito peppers: corn puree, maldon salt ($6) This was Peter's pick. I love shishito peppers and these were prepared well. The corn puree was on the sweeter side for me though.  Housemade pickles: fennel, beet, cucumber, cauliflower, carrot ($7) I love a good pickled vegetable! It was kind of a small portion for $7, but had a good variety of veggies.  Kennebec fries: juniper salt, olive aioli ($6) My favorite dish! And I typically don't even eat a lot of carbs. But how can I say no to fries?! They were salty and soft in the center. I wasn't sure I was going like the olive aioli, but it actually tasted good with the fries. I kept picking at this dish.  Chinatown duck sliders: shiitake, bok choy, hoisin ($10) I was thinking about ordering this and then Rodney said he wanted to try it. Perfect, since I love sharing! Unfortunately, I didn't really care for the duck. It was too sweet and tender for me. Texture was nothing like the ducks you see hanging in the windows in Chinatown. Maybe they should call this duck confit sliders?  Grilled cheese sandwich: smoked mozzarella, pickled peppers ($8) Peter's pick. I had a couple bites. I think the smokiness of the cheese overpowered this sandwich. It was a little too smoky for me. Plus, it didn't have enough cheese, so you didn't get that comforting gooey cheesiness!  Overall, Maven was a nice place to check out for a couple cocktails and small bites. Typically I don't like sitting at communal tables since everyone's conversations can start overlapping. But it was fine at Maven since it wasn't too busy. Plus I like the feel of the space downstairs. Overall, I loved the cocktails! The food was a little lackluster for me, but okay as snacks while you throw back a few drinks.

DuDxDT2Oedn5fkSMLL9Enw.review_text: Okay, but not great.  Not sure what they are trying to achieve - is a bar with food?  A tapas style restaurant with an extensive cocktail menu?    The food was alright, but portions small even for a small plate place.  The duck sliders were the best of what we had and packed with flavor.  The flank steak was cooked properly and had some nice veg along with it.  The fennel and burrata had nice combinations but only two little puddles of the cheese buried underneath the watercress.  The char and the squid were unremarkable.  Our server seemed a bit surly for some reason (boarding on rude), although he was reasonably attentive and efficient.

77D4tq3r81tRkv7fy_j8kg.review_text: Drinks are always yummy but a tad on the medicinal side.  Duck sliders are always a must. Upstairs is chic but comfortable. Love the "living garden" wall behind the bar.

uEAJf9YXnZJofVawOjEsCg.review_text: I was really looking forward to liking this new neighborhood watering hole with a substantial bar menu (or is it a tapas restaurant with a cocktail list?).   Unfortunately, there is nothing special about Maven.  One gold star because we were seated right away on a Friday night, and no one cared that we were just ordering drinks.  We were also offered better seats since they opened up before we had ordered.  Another star because when my friend was unhappy with how his food was cooked (I thought it was fine), they took it back and replaced it no questions asked.  Things go wrong in restaurants.  The real issue is how the staff deals with it, and they did the right thing in this case.  But that's about it for the good!  Otherwise the service was... inattentive.  We both ordered drinks, but only one came out.  After our food arrived, we had to ask for forks.  And flagging down a server was not easy.  Not to mention that our server smelled so strongly of baby powder (I'm not kidding) that it made it difficult to enjoy the taste of anything we were having.  The list is cluttered with some wines and beers listed on the front of the menu and a similar (but slightly different) selection on the back.  Maybe it's set up as suggested pairings, but it doesn't read that way.   And the actual wines you can buy down the street at Whole Foods or Falletti.  Not impressed.  Add to that one kind of gross-out moment at the chef's counter, and that's enough for me to say I probably won't be back, except maybe for a mid-week cocktail.  Overall impression:  Who is this place for, and does that person exist in SF?

toOht-Wn-X3g30GFpMkP4w.review_text: Came here with a friend since he had a coupon for a meal + alcohol pairing. It's been a month or so since I was here so I don't remember some of the pairings that came with the meal, but I'll try to do my best!  The first item was the autumn chestnut ravioli. Everything about that dish was really good. I really like the maitake that came with it, but the who dish combined was really good. The second dish was the local artic char. The char was very tasty and wasn't dry, it was cooked nicely. The brussels sprouts that came with it was tasty, I just wish it wasn't so burnt though. The entire outside part was black... granted it didn't taste burnt, it just didn't look as appealing. The third dish was the Chinatown Duck Sliders. They were pretty tiny... but I guess it's a slider. I also don't get why they called it "Chinatown" since it didn't taste Chinese to me at all. Other than that, the flavor and everything was pretty good and well flavored. I forgot the fourth dish but it was dessert and I don't think I cared too much for it since I don't remember it.  Some of the drinks that came with the meal that I remember were the 5 spot and the Maven's Milk Punch. The 5 spot was alright, I didn't care too much for it... not one of my favorite cocktails. Maven's Milk Punch was okay, I just didn't like the milky aftertaste it left. The other 2 drinks I don't remember but I just remembered out of the whole meal, I only liked 1 of the pairings and the other 3 I didn't care for.  Overall the meal was good. The only quirk I have is that after the meal, my friend and I were still hungry but we didn't want to order from here again so we just went elsewhere to eat. You would think a 4 course meal would keep you stuffed but it didn't. Place is clean and service is pretty nice though. Worth giving a try, but come ordering extra since the portions are a bit tiny.

y-vdVYvQ_qM8X32wspcMjg.review_text: This place is ok.   The drinks are good, the space is pretty nice, and the food is all right.  But they seem to have a bit of an identity crisis.  Am I a bar?  Am I a lounge?  Am I a restaurant?  Can't I be all three.......?  No you can not.

kQohi7SKPo8J16xXsYKDKg.review_text: Just came in for a cocktail before dinner. I got the Devil's halo cocktail ($10) (similar to an old fashioned) and my boyfriend got a Viking bottled beer ($8).  My cocktail was prepared down to a science and the beer was delicious. Prices will prevent us from coming in too much, but it was a great experience.

WWkyqHT8l7jb-h-H1d9Xjw.review_text: I was honestly bored out of my mind with the food here. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either. Duck Sliders: OK, decent,  Calamari: they mixed grilled calamari with fried calamari and added a boring cream sauce to it. I wasn't a fan because the grilled calamari did not go with the sauce. The vegetable tart: what can I say except for how much skill and innovation does it honestly take to deconstruct a tart and put all the ingredients that should be inside a tart scattered all over my plate with the bread crumble in big chunks everywhere. I thought it was rather dull. The steak: It was well cooked and tasted fine. Nothing spectacular was just a steak. Dessert was the the Mayan chocolate: a few brownies with a little vanilla ice cream and some spiced shavings all over the place and some chili pepper decoratively sprinkled all over the plate. It tasted fine but not all that creative really. One thing that I found  really confusing was how the menu was set up. You have drinks and food all mish mashed together all over the place. It would be nice if they separated drinks from food so I can efficiently order. That being said, the experience was OK. Nowhere near the bottom but nowhere near the top either. In the end, I'm wowed by good flavor not overly creative esthetically plated food. On a good note, the cocktails they make there are incredible so I would def. swing by the bar for a drink and maybe go some place else for dinner.  One more thing to the wait staff: When  a customer asks you "what is amazing on here  that I have to try?" or "What do you think of such and such dish?" Your response should almost NEVER be: "Everything is good"  Vague answers tell me that you are either not in touch with the food or that there isn't anything that great  that stands out on the menu. Your job as a waiter is to GUIDE customers to a great experience.   All in all though, the Service was Very Good and attentive and I did feel that I was served well.  If someone knows something I don't..perhaps food I need to try that I didn't try, please let me know.

wz1_t7H_s7mOVeoIb7_qfA.review_text: I don't get out to San Francisco as much as I used to, so when I do get the chance to try out an impressive place I feel like I have to take the time to put in my 2 cents worth on Yelp.  The inside of the place promises that you know you are in for something special right when you walk in.  Maven has a modern, industrial look with big communal tables and a huge living wall mounted above the bar...you are sure to score a great cocktail here.  Someone in the group had already ordered a (pitcher?) of Global Warming [aged Gin, Sake, Riesling, Lemon, Absinthe Sorbet] - awesome.  Not something I would have ordered on my own, but getting a group together forces me to venture out of my Vodka shell.  I don't remember their Vodka selection being very big, but they still made a martini later on in the night.  The food, of course, was well presented - Autumn Chestnut Ravioli being the best thing out of everything ordered.  Outstanding service as well.  I'm not going to surprise you by saying parking in the Lower Haight can be tricky on a weekend night, but I happened to find a spot right out front the second I pulled up.  I guess everything just worked out perfect for once.  I will definitely will be back if I am in the neighborhood anytime soon!

CQ8OSQFPCCoo0ujxEyEVRA.review_text: In all honesty, we went in with the wrong expectations. We probably should not have expected a filling dinner but instead amazing drinks with some bites on the side. If you go in for that, you will love this place.   Tried a majority of the menu though:  Loved:  Savory Winter Tart  Chinatown Duck Sliders Arctic Char deserves a mention as well  Would not get again: Braised Fennel and Watercress - very chewy and difficult to eat. Butternut Squash Ravioli (can't remember the exact name) - while good this dish is really nothing special from the normal variety offered at nice restaurants  The drinks were really quite tasty though and I would definitely go back for them.
