3tE34VqKUGPuiKZ8w9tW-Q.review_text: Had been wanting to check out this spot since it's down the road.  Very impressed with the interior, modern but not cold.  Great lighting, cool communal wooden tables (that aren't weird or crammed), great upstairs lounge with fireplace and bar.    I guess their drinks?  Seemed like some pretty interesting and unique cocktails on the menu, as well as beer/wine.   Overall, was a little disappointed with the menu.  Small plates mean really small.  Had a couple of small plates, calamari and burrata and beet salad which were both really good.  However, left feeling starving.    I'll definitely go back, just not expecting to eat a ton.

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: Dinner and drinks. And drinks.  Inspired cocktail menu made it hard to choose. Another round was a wise choice.  Take The Money And Plum and Hometown Vixen. Can't go wrong with either.  Setting is equally inspired. Light fixtures have pops of red. Communal tables. Walls that literally come alive with plant life. Open kitchen. Upstairs nook with a fireplace.  Sleek, assured and ambitious.  Unfortunately the food fell just short.   Crab was overwhelmed by avocado.  Summer squash tortellini (small size) had only four pieces of the outstanding pasta.  Smoked creme fraíche base was the only thing memorable from our albacore main.  Only dessert rivaled the drinks and design. Lemon chiffron cake with a small scoop of yuzu ice cream and strawberry rhubarb was spectacular.  Would have traded a third round of drinks for a second round of dessert.  Come thirsty and with a sweet tooth. You can skip the rest.

796OmGM6yE1BOm--y0M1gg.review_text: Beautiful restaurant, excellent food, great cocktails.    I have been here twice and we ordered a bunch of different things off of the menu to share and they were all delicious, so I would recommend ordering anything.  The food and experience were great, but the reason I am giving four stars and not five is the service.  Both times I was there the servers were extremely slow to come by and acknowledge our party and take drink orders.  And during both meals, when glasses were empty, it took quite some time for the servers to come by and take our next drink orders.  This is kind of a big thing for me - I love long meals, I don't mind a more relaxed service pace, but I feel strongly that drinks at dinner should stay full.  And why wouldn't a server want to liquor up the patrons?  Raises the bill and the tip, and being a little boozy when the wallet comes out always loosens the purse strings!  Anyway, that's my only gripe, otherwise the place is excellent!  I brought friends with me on my second trip, and will definitely do so again in the future, and recommend it frequently.

SMuYJ9REz5IIgNYt7qwDXQ.review_text: The venue itself is really nice. Really modern and upscale.  However, the food was a bit dissappointing. When you're reading the descriptions on the menu, everything seriously sounds so good and exotic. However, the food that actually came out tasted bland and some of it was even on the weird side.  The oysters had a very unique sweet taste to them that just didn't go well with the oysters at all. The duck sliders were way too plain and they just weren't a hit at our table. The burger was pretty bland and the person who ordered it didn't even finish it. The mussels were okay, but nothing to get too excited about. Overall, this was just another forgettable meal, even though the venue and menu made everything seem so promising.  The drinks were actually better than the food, but it's just cocktails and beers. There's a lot of places on Haight Street to get good cocktails and beers, so I really couldn't justify coming back here.

mZFOgIKHumXzfFuN7iuHqQ.review_text: Cute place. My friends and I enjoyed Maven a lot. Great place to grab drinks with friends or with a date before dinner or another social event. Small intimate space. Communal tables, floor plan, and minimal noise allow for socializing.   Cocktails, wine, and food were all excellent. Cocktails were the big standout. I personally liked the Global Warming and Summer's Kiss. As for service, every single person was friendly and attentive. The only slip-up was that they kept bringing the wrong second drink to my friend. We overlooked that since there were so many pluses. I would recommend Maven!

ksLEtpBAdVGaEramRXYYSQ.review_text: Tried the burger... HUGE fan! They keep it simple and straight to the point. I will say this burger grew on me as I ate, and even more so after I left. Cooked well, munster cheese, good bread. Whats not to like?

owU33KfcbqX0uTDMv1RJJg.review_text: Got the duck hash, billionaire bacon and OJ, all were amazing!! Duck hash is a must-get. Service was fast and friendly and I enjoyed the motif. Great choice for breakfast / brunch!

E6cw3Hd-xB05ghEr3_0zRw.review_text: Duck sliders.  Gnocchi.  Brussel sprouts.  Try them.  There isn't much food on the menu, but A LOT of drink selections.  I think this place isn't ideal if you're hungry.  Better for snacking and drinking.  I got corpse reviver, which was very refreshing.  Knock yourself out.  Just don't get really drunk and make an ass of yourself, ok?  They probably won't like that.

MzXPOK2_T5O8GF-4qUVmGA.review_text: Best restaurant in the Haight, bar none.  Cocktails, wine, food, ambience, service.  Maven crushes it. The finer points...  The modern & sophisticated space is both upscale & comfortable.  You're home, but like Mad Men home.    Mezzanine w a fireplace.  The sofa next to the fireplace, that's my seat.  You can have it when I'm not there.  The lighting is perfect.  Not easy to do or find.    Duck sliders, gnocchi, fries, cheese plate. All home runs.  The sliders just rock.  Maven takes their food & their cocktails very seriously.  Example: When was the last time you saw a drink made w absinthe sorbet?  They pour champagne over it.  Exactly.  Worth making a trip to the Haight for.

s8nkbQAlrVPfg1u4anGKtw.review_text: maven also mavin (m v n). n. A person who has special knowledge or experience; an expert.  Considering we bellied up to the bar with only a general understanding of what we wanted and somehow were blessed with delicious cocktails, I'd say this spot can rightfully claim the title of Maven.  Dark and sexy with clean lines and a long bar, I'd like to plant myself on a chair and really get into the mix here. Perhaps next time I'm in SF, we'll spend sometime and some dollah bills.

fx1BCzrggSQUT4Q6edPHwg.review_text: I'm still deciding how I felt about Maven.  I went last night with a couple friends for some drinks and a bite. The cocktails were yummy (probably the best part of the experience) and the food was somewhere near "American Fusion". None of the food was spectacular, but it wasn't awful either. It was...interesting. Filling without being overwhelming. My friend did comment that the blue cheese seemed "too moldy" upon which the chef did not agree (he was nice about it).  Our waiter was friendly, but basically sucked. He spilled beer on the table and rather than clean it up he just said "oops". Ha! He also wasn't around much when we needed him.  Anyway, if you're in the neighborhood and want dinner, go to Uva Enoteca down the street rather than Maven. Hit up Maven for a fun cocktail afterwards.   P.S. It closes at 12am so last call is early

dmRRi4ZKh8M-5EovWoRNiA.review_text: I live in the neighborhood and have been highly anticipating Maven's opening for months and dined there tonight on day 3.  The space is beautiful.  The tables are made of redwood, there's a vertical garden on the wall above the bar and the high windows make for excellent people watching on Haight Street if you sit on the second level.  The service is also top notch.  Every staff member was extremely friendly and our food came out really quickly.  The food is high quality and tasty, but very small, especially for the price.  The drinks aren't cheap either, but that's what you have to expect when dining at a place like Maven.  I had the Winter Tart - a deconstructed mushroom tart, which was quite tasty and butternut squash ravioli, which was rich, but very good.  I will definitely be back.  This is a great spot to enjoy a glass of wine or cocktail with a good friend over a small plate of food.    I recommend getting there before 6:30 for the first couple of months if you don't want to wait for a table.  They don't take reservations.  I sent them an email earlier in the week and they responded very quickly and suggested I come in before 7pm to avoid a wait.

TQzDqaxDDEeJcnWjTUe7Gg.review_text: I went here on a date and was pleasantly surprised by many things (i'll start with those) and disappointed by a couple.  Pleased: -The rustic-jungly atmosphere was awesome--eating dinner in what feels like a greenhouse/apothecary's shop was quite unique. Plants hung from bar to ceiling and I couldn't help but wonder how they water them. The addition of the community seating was a nice touch but not for an intimate date. The second floor overlooks the rest of the place and gave plenty of opportunities for people watching.  -The food (most of it). Cheese plate was delicious but did not come with enough bread, and I found myself wishing it was crostini not soft french bread, but I digress...Duck sliders were delectable and had excellent flavor. The heirloom tomatoes tasted like tomatoes should: fruity, tangy and sweet. I only wished we could have eaten all of them before our plate was snagged away (see disappointed category below).  Disappointed: -The service. Scratch that, the server, who barely spoke a word to us, and gave a condescending and surprised look when we asked to see the list for bottles of wine (yes, even plaid wearing people can afford bottles of wine, sir). The only time he spoke up was when describing the wine (maybe making up for his demeaning attitude earlier) and ranted on for 5 minutes! After that though, we were back to our void-of-personality-self who either came too early and took dishes away before done (tomatoes), or taking forever to make room for new plates.  -The pork loin & shoulder. It was good. But not $25 good. Slightly dry and lacked something... Chef Banks at Five in Berkeley may be at fault for my high standards, but I am OK with that.  All in all I liked Maven, and will not discredit the restaurant for a server who may have just been having a bad day....

0-xIU4qXFQXe6x1rVQcpqg.review_text: We stopped in here for a bite to eat. Great menu with a lot of variety. I had the calamari. It was prepared 2 separate ways. Fried and grilled. It was like 2 appetizers in one. This was delicious.  My son had a burger that was also good.  Very reasonably priced. The chef was hyper focused on detail.  We sat at the chefs bar and watched preparation of all the plates.

fdySAY88KLWu74XjRp-tdQ.review_text: Not a bad place, I rather enjoyed the living wall above the bar.  And it's hard to beat a corner location for a restaurant in the city. My bf and I had the salad, sliders, frys, and pickles. I have to say I enjoyed the salad the best. Toasted quinoa and goat cheese, creamy with a crunch. Get the salad!  The duck sliders... I felt were missing that spark of flavor. Drinks?  Good. ( what we had) there is one with bourbon and something... And black pepper. It's served on the rocks.. Very tasty..   Overall=  Service was prompt and attentive, almost too attentive when cleaning off the plates, but nothing to be upset over. I did think the restaurant was missing that pizazz you expect when you pay 80 bucks and live feeling kinda "eh".   More of a neighborhood restaurant.

gSqxSw8CvnKpxjzNyuCkYw.review_text: The brunch at maven is delicious. I had the duck hash and it had a really nice flavor and was cooked well. The service is also friendly and attentive.   I have two big complaints about Maven, however:  (1) The seating is at long communal tables with bar stools, which is just uncomfortable and awkward for everyone. They need to just switch to regular individual tables. Everyone prefers individual tables. Communal tables are dumb.  (2) The prices are high compared to the portion size. For example, toast does not come with your order. In my opinion, toast should be complementary with brunch. We ordered some, and for $3 got three little pieces of toast. It was good toast, but not worth $1 for each little piece.

1eOf0y_ndQPaQVcE2v6tDA.review_text: My  boss took me and a co-worker here for drinks and some appetizers. I will be coming back.  The restaurant itself is really pretty (especially at night) and makes you feel like you want to sit there for hours with a best friend or lover and talk about anything and everything, while sipping their classy, smart cocktails. There's just something about this place...  Anyways, for cocktails, I had:  -Peruvian Panty Dropper (pisco, asian pear, cran-honey, lemon). I effing LOVED this drink and wanted 2 more but chose to continue to explore their awesome cocktail menu.  -Hires' Hand  (rye, maple, root beer spice, charred rosemary). This was a little sweet for me, but somehow also managed to be SUPER strong (that's a good thing!) and the charred rosemary smelled like Christmas. That made me happy.  -Pumpkin Spiced Notte (cognac, pumpkin, allspice, hazelnut, lemon, egg white). You know how basic b*tches love pumpkin spice lattes? Well, whatever the opposite of a basic b*tch is, that's who loves these pumpkin spiced nottes. Seriously. I wanted to dive into my little cocktail glass and swim circles while humming the song from the Lego movie "Everything is Awesommmmeeeeeeeee!!!!!....". Order this drink, or you will have 10 years bad luck.  Appetizers we shared: P.E.I. Mussels, Kennebec Fries, Broccoli Tempura and Crispy Brussels Sprouts. The mussel broth was great, the bread they serve with the mussels was BORN to be dipped in that broth (don't be shy and ask for an extra side of that bread). The Brussel sprouts were crispy and heavenly. I wasn't crazy about the broccoli and the fries were fries.   I think our waitress was pregnant. She was super nice and attentive.   See you soon Maven!

RmG1YouzOHWi1i87j5oeBw.review_text: I would give 5 stars for the service here (super attentive, friendly, and courteous) but had to give 3 stars for the food and cocktail quality, as well as the atmosphere.  I ordered the brisket and pickled vegetables.  The pickled veggies were kind of mediocre, and were also served in a tiny mason jar that is not really appetizing to stick your fork into when sharing with others.  The brisket tasted alright, but it was kind of dry, and it was so dark in the restaurant that I went to go eat my last bite without realizing it was pure fat.  Pretty gross.  On my second cocktail I also asked them to adjust one of the ingredients, which the bartender didn't do, and that was a little disappointing. Like I said, I loved the service, the hostess and our waiter were awesome, but I wasn't in love with what I ordered.

Lw6agCKyeuFa0yR_JzQALw.review_text: This corner a few blocks from my house used to host RNM for a number of years which was a favorite of mine.  I went back there in hopes of the same great food and ambiance.  So my first thought was "copy cat" of NOPA, with the community tables and the way it was set up.  I gave this 2 stars as it could be a romantice date place to go for a glass of wine upstairs infront of the fire place, but I would stay away from the food.  I came there after work and even after ordering 6-7 small/regular size plates me and my friend were still hungry and ended up getting some slices of pizza down the street afterwards. The calamari was just 4-5 small pieces, stringy and a bland sauce with it - the worst I've had I think.....  The vegetable tart did not look anything like a tart, more like 3-4 cookies with some random ingredients scattered around the place and a bit of a sauce, I honestly don't remember what other 3 plates we had - must have been that bland as I normally remember great food.  So I feel ike I had to write this review as the place was a huge dissapointment. Again for a glass of wine and to sit wtih a date upstairs, perhaps it serve its purpose.

6fiLodPoSKcHPsL-jDzlTw.review_text: The small plates are awesome, we tried the duck sliders and the butternut squash ravioli. The drinks are also delicious! My favorite is the global warming :) The cool ambiance + patient servers!Will be coming back again for sure!

-PoCbyNa4xc4yvReuj5pqw.review_text: Much better than RMN (or whatever that former tenants name was).  We sat at the chef's counter which I normally eschew but in this case preferred to the family style tables.  Charcuterie was notable in that it was all rillettes/pates no sausage type meats.  Deconstructed foraged mushroom tart was tasty.  Duck sliders had some kick and the braised fennel was a dream. I particularly liked ordering drinks with silly names and although dessert was not to her liking she very much enjoyed the overall meal and terrific service.

9Yb3j3z_0ll3Wh4zHRNKBg.review_text: Duck Sliders were good. Drinks are good. Very nice place to take a date for apps and drinks.

TFQSu3FePjR6EDlTwKQuUw.review_text: I really enjoy how their menu is paired with cocktails in addition to beers and wine. I love a good drink / buzz when I am out dining and it's nice to see artisan cocktails paired with even more interesting food.  I had the Fireside cocktail, calamari two ways, duck sliders, & the brussel sprouts - all of which were spectacular and surprising. I've had each of these types of plates at a number of restaurants before but I was still surprised at how different they were able to arrange these plates. The calamari was served 1/2 of the plated grilled and the other fried all sitting in an amazing sauce. I loved the variety of textures. The duck sliders were a decent size, meat was flavorful and tender but the wow-moment was the large shitake mushrooms inside. The brussel sprouts were by far the most rich in flavor, served burnt - the brussels had a unique crispy texture and soaked in a tangy vinaigrette. I eat brussel as an every day veggie but this dish blew my mind.   Maven is excellent for dates. Soft dim lighting in an approachable community table type atmosphere. Sexy but casual. Rich without being expensive.   Bravo SF. Bravo.

TmDaYip-8qSuSIMtYW872Q.review_text: Maven is a great spot off Haight St with sleek decor and good looking staff. The BF and I came with another couple after having bought a deal. We tried a tasting menu that was good, though not amazing. Here were some of the highlights (or not):  Autumn chestnut ravioli - sweet, buttery and almost melted in your mouth  Local albacore - seared. Not my favorite.  Peanut butter mousse - I don't have a sweet tooth, but this was really good!  Towards the end, we were hanging out after our meal on one of their high rise communal tables and somehow got to talking to the waiter about chartreuse. He let us taste it because we were curious about it, which was nice of him. Service was good and the actual spot is nice, but I wouldn't say it's a must-return immediately place for me. That being said, I'd come back to just hang out at the bar.

B35Nwmd15-0WNdI-8jISOA.review_text: Nice new spot popping up in the lower Haight. The ambiance is really cool, with long communal tables, living wall and a fully stocked bar with a variety of beers on tap. I came here late night with some friends, and we shared some sliders, char and skirt steak. The sliders were eh, and we could have done without them. The char was ok, but I probably wouldn't order it again. The steak was delicious and still pretty bloody when served at the table. I loved it.  We also got some type of dessert, which was overly sweet. Allegedly, the have cool cocktails here that I would consider trying. Maybe for apps and drinks, but for a full dinner at this price, please save your money and wait at Nopa.

9W73B44Iw8WslrTNB2CdCg.review_text: This was exactly the sort of place I was looking to get my drink on in San Francisco, great cocktails at a reasonable price in a great location in terms of service, ambiance and overall layout of the space.   Both drinks I had tasted as great as they sounded on the menu and our crab and avocado plate was fantastic. It's a great spot for after dinner drinks, if you're lucky you'll get to sit on the second floor bar style seats overlooking the restaurant (we weren't as lucky) it ought to make for great people watching. Most of the first floor is dedicated to communal seating but it didn't feel intrusive at all. And most people there were attractive enough that I wouldn't have complained too much if we were a little bit smudged together. They have a great bar area, the bartenders crafting their drinks are surely fun to watch with an open kitchen located towards the back. It's got enough food items to keep your appetite in check, but perhaps not the best place to come to expecting a full on meal.   With so many options open to us in the city for drinks I'm certainly glad I chose this to venture out to.

44QJFy-EUL18Z5xcwPP6pQ.review_text: Went for brunch a few weeks back, wasn't really impressed with the menu. Ordered a sandwich, was a little messy to eat. Think i'll pass on the brunch going forward but do want to come back for dinner service.  This is a nice looking place

L1-9TShQ28ZvV9J0_kT5hA.review_text: The ambience is very trendy and modern, yet the food was awful. Being Gluten Free, I ordered the bacon, the sausage and two fried eggs, with the yokes runny. My sister ordered the good day omelet. We got to the restaurant at opening and sat at the chefs bar, mistake number one! Let me tell you, you do not want to sit and watch as the kitchen literally throws away your food TWICE before cooking you the "correct" form of eggs on the third try. Probably the most frustrating thing I've experienced in a looooong time. Meanwhile we watch as they send the omelet made for my sister to another patron, because my food isn't finished, only to let my sisters remade food sit on top of the oven for another 10 minutes waiting for them to make my food, yet again. Meanwhile they have already cooked our bacon and our sausage, but do they remake those?? Of course not! Because who doesn't love dry, crumbly sausage, or weirdly burnt at the ends and raw in the middle bacon? I kid you not Yelpers, this was what was served to me. So finally I receive my eggs, gotta say I had HIGH hopes of delicious yokey (yes yokey, it may not be a word in your book but it is in mine) eggs, only to cut those baby opens and have runny white come flowing out! Who doesn't want some salmonella with their breakfast? I know I do! I literally ate one bite of everything, and when the poor sweet waitress, who was completely innocent in this entire food experience, comes over to ask how my meal was? Let me tell you!!! Nooooot great. A shining light? They removed all of the crappy  food that was served to me from my bill. What was left? The French press coffee (okay, not enough cream is given and half the coffee had settled to the bottom before it even got to our table) and my sisters omelet, which was luke warm, rather than hot and fresh, as food should be... Who knew putting a plate on top of an oven wouldn't keep it fresh and hot for the future consumer? Not the kitchen that's for sure.   All in all Yelpers, do not bother. I would suggest other meals but the couple next to use got the duck hash and looked just about as happy with it as we did with our meal.   The wait staff was great, we tipped our server based on the original bill because we didn't think she deserved to lose out.  Find a new brunch spot.

b3fyMswqU5-_UXk2Gmze0Q.review_text: The rating is really difficult for me. I come here frequently due to the proximity to my home, but I have mixed feelings.   The decor is modern and interesting, but somehow feels cold and uninviting.   I've been here for numerous dinners and brunch. Nothing ever stands out when it comes to dinner or cocktails so I'd skip it altogether and give this place a try for brunch. The brunch menu does not disappoint. I think the last time I was there I had the crab cakes; they were fabulous.I guess I never feel like the price/wait is ever worth it. #SFproblems.

Noa1obP4fKO3bqL5km88HQ.review_text: For a new restaurant/bar, I was impressed with Maven. The decor and atmosphere was sophisticated, yet casually fun. There are communal tables on the main floor, and a more loungy area upstairs, with bar stools overlooking the main floor for good people watching.   The highlight was definitely the drinks. They were great. Some of the best drinks I've had in the city. Well balanced and interesting combinations. The bartender (Chase) was very helpful in helping us decide what drinks would fit each person's tastes.    The food was pretty good. Calamari was my favorite. The fries with aioli sauce was also simple, but tasty. We also had the sliders, burger, butternut squash pasta, charcuterie plate (chicken liver pate was deliciously smooth).   Also, the service was great. We were able to meet the owner, who was very nice and down to earth. Our server, Rick, was extremely knowledgeable about the drinks and food menu and very attentive.  Overall, I would recommend this place and will definitely be back for a good time.

scU3ND9j6WYe8ziOa770vA.review_text: The food/cocktail/wine+beer pairing idea is genius. I wish there is a place like Maven in south bay. It's not easy to find a place that serves handcrafted cocktails like Maven. Every dish from their small menu is delicious. I need more of this!!

wjg3Ett7YxSFX1RULiH1Tg.review_text: First a disclaimer:  I am in the service industry and have very mixed feelings about Yelp, but my negative experience at Maven inspired me to join.  I wish it was possible to give negative stars.  I tried to dine at Maven on Friday night the week after they opened.  Keep in mind I work in the service industry and to have a Friday night off is RARE.  Of course I wanted to spend my precious Friday night off somewhere I've been so eager to try.  We arrive at Maven and were greeted by the host,  the conversation goes something like this:  Host:  Sorry we are at capacity right now Me: No problem, can we please get on the list?  Host: No we don't take a list.  Me: Uhm ok?? Can we get a drink at the bar? Host: No I'm sorry we are at capacity. I suggest going next door to Uva and come back in 30 minutes   We promptly left and I think I stood outside with my mouth down to the floor for about 10 minutes.  I was totally stunned and could not make any sense of what just happened.    I have worked in the service industry for 13 years and I have never heard anything so ridiculous.  Luckily the establishment I work for takes reservations, but I totally understand Maven's choice not to.  However, if you're not going to take reservations, you have to take a wait list! I know the guys who own this place are industry heavy hitters and they should know better.  Come on guys, this is a pretty amateur move, I  cannot understand why this policy is in place.  This policy should definitely be reconsidered, it is a huge turnoff.  In a city full of so many restaurants to choose from this is a big no-no  I was really hoping for great things for this place, I love the idea of a cocktail driven menu. But the negative experience has left a bad taste in my mouth and I don't see myself returning until they change the seating policy.

qstOF_b3pvyVPyq4Qsyw-A.review_text: A fun place for locals to enjoy some nice food and good drinks. My roommates and I came here on Valentines Day to just grab a drink at around 10pm. We had the upstairs to our selves so we just lounged around in front of the fireplace. I had myself a hefenweizen (pardon the bad spelling) and it was a really good imported heff. Probably one of the best I've ever had. All the food is paired with a specific drink so their menu is very unique. The decor is nice and the waiters are pretty attentive and friendly. The owner was around so he made sure we were having a good time. My roommate didn't really like her drink so he got her another no charge. Now that is good service. I think my roommates and I might make it a nice chill spot for weekday nights we just need to get a drink and get out of the house.

vdkpw-d-t1sdxadJKJCIoA.review_text: This place is an awesome spot to chill and have a few drinks and some food. We have now visited here a couple of times in the last month.  The ambience is great and the place has a very modern classy feel to it. With the bar area and the classic seating for meals, it also has a great spot at the top of the stairs which overlooks the whole 1st floor.  The drinks are very reasonably priced and the bar tenders are very friendly indeed. The young lady that served us during our first visit was very helpful and even though the kitchen was closing she still managed to get us some bites to accompany our drinks.  The bar food is great and the sit-down main meals are very tasty indeed.  The last time we made it for brunch and the menu though precise and less items were very tasty. I had the Braised Brisket sandwich and shared the Duck hash with my partner which was elegently prepared.  All in all this is a must visit place for both great food and drinks.

vLAALOTK9-0YQOxlGhHrDw.review_text: My friends and I decided to visit Maven for a late dinner after driving into SF from LA. We were tired, hungry and thirsty for some SF adventure so we headed over to Maven and promptly waited for a very long time for a table. It's all good though. We ordered drinks at the bar and got tipsy while we waited for our table. The drinks were amazing, btw. I was enjoying watching the bartenders make drinks. Our bartender had this awesome tattoo on his arm and in my tired and tipsy haze, I was watching his arms shaking all the drinks and thinking how his arms must be so strong. :/  Anyways, we were finally seated upstairs at one of the couches so we ordered another round of drinks while we waited for our food. I really enjoyed both drinks I got that night (International Mistress and Cats Meow) but my friend didn't like her second drink. I'm not sure what she got because the studly arm tattoo bartender made something for her after asking what she likes. HOWEVER, the point of this story is that our waitress (who was also really awesome because she asked us if we needed rescuing when two guys came up to us and started chatting) must have noticed my friend didn't really touch her drink because the bartender came upstairs and personally asked if she liked the drink. I was really impressed by this attention to detail. My friend tried to be polite but he knew she didn't like the drink so he took it away and we weren't charged for it.   I honestly cannot remember what we ordered to eat but it was all quite delicious. I just remember the gnocchi was amazing and we wished we had skipped all the other foods and ordered five of the gnocchi. Wishful thinking.

oEwrWf7GKtCaf0WmismW9g.review_text: Look this is a perfectly nice place.  Its got pretty people, charming staff and genuinely great cocktails and nice glass ware.  The decor is a little off putting and the lighting sort of just wrong but who really cares.  Food is 2 Star at best though - brisket was dry , oysters were somehow loaded with fresh water and squid just insipid.  Go for a drink, go for a lot of drinks and get a taco on the way home

vlELEyIv1faCIaGmXPvTCw.review_text: I've been waiting for this place to open for a while. RNM sucked and was a waste of a perfectly good space on a great corner of this little city of ours. I just went last night for drinks with my GF on our way home from dinner elsewhere. She had the Global Warming which comes with an absinthe sorbet (wtf) and loved. I need to add that she HATES absinthe, well she did at least. The service is cool, with being open only 2 night they were calm and collected and it was nice to see it so packed on a Thursday. I'm sure there will be some kinks to work out, but that should be expected with something so new. And to Noah G who's trying to get a hold of the staff, just go knock on the door in the day time. Someone is usually there or go in and get a drink at night while you make your purchase.

nAWptWyuZeQSZIr-rCuHQg.review_text: Great Atmosphere and Great Food. This place is a new client of my brother in law. They get their beef product from him. So yes, I had to get the burger and it was very tasty. It was very difficult to find parking, but it was 7pm on a Friday Night. We parked about 4 blocks away, but it was well worth it. Thank chef for bringing us out some "extra treats". We really appreciated the gesture and hope your restaurant continues to thrive.

diow7HqTQ0egIl2T08vLkQ.review_text: Sexy. Like "this is wrong but I can't stop myself" sexy.

u9KhzES5reUljwccEyFdJw.review_text: I was torn whether or not to give 4 stars... But all in all i enjoyed my night here. We sat at the bar which was cool because we got to watch all of the food being made. kudos for that! As for food items I ate the duck sliders-mmm delish, king salmon cant really go wrong with slices of salmon, mixed greens with the goat cheese- for a salad this was pretty darn good!, and the kennebec fries- just your average fries...a little on the salty side though.  Id love to come back and try more pairings

uM6oNmSFISzji0mU081KjQ.review_text: My boyfriend and I came here and we couldn't have asked for a better evening. An impromptu decision for dinner, we both wanted to try something new, so into Maven we went!   We sat at the bar and service was quick and very friendly. We started with cocktails and because they were so delicious we never moved onto wine. Everything we ordered was fantastic, I remember one dish in particular really standing out. The corn and strawberry soup. yes, strawberry. I mean whoa, it was fantastic! the flavors were unlike anything I've tried in a soup before, very well done.   Overall great expereince, I will definitly be back.

_Oez2RrXLXxA4k0U-jA4FQ.review_text: Super yummy cheese plate and the gnocchi was wonderful with these charred Brussels sprouts were delicious!  Great service at the bar and the atmosphere and music were pretty nice.  Serves food pretty late, which is how I ended up discovering it, while searching for a late night cheese plate.  We will definitely be back for sure!  :)

x_M7QcgwkaPsNubp1RfWzg.review_text: My sister and I went here on a whim before attending the SF symphony. No reso required and we were sat immediately. The vibe is classy, upscale and the community tables are inviting. I had a beer and my sister asked the bartender to make her something citrusy and delicious and he did.   We had the Oysters on a half shell, the duck sliders, the lemony Brussels which seemed to have some balsamic reduction and maybe some soy sauce *amazing*. We also got the gnocchi, the portion was small but they were good.   Perfect place for a couple share plates before an event.

d-w5MK72D_1zfrmGfSINkw.review_text: Swung by this laid back yet stylish eatery with a splendid artisanal cocktail menu on NYE (pre-dinner cocktails).   Ambiance Dim lighting, organic decor, dark wood furishings, upstairs deck lounge with fire place. Reminds me of a smaller NOPA with less chatter.  Service Exceptional; not too fussy, good verbiage for newbies.   Drinks My cocktail of choice would have to be Global Warming.

pSms5uzIwl_eM6Gi7vVFYQ.review_text: Great spot to meet friends for happy hour if you're sick of the crowded FiDi spots. Super creative mixed drinks and sumptuous appetizers. Also, super friendly wait and bar staff. Love that this spot exists and doesn't take an hour to get into.

xnlVxgrLP5HgaKZobRuHZA.review_text: Hip place. Conveniently located on Haight. Reminds me A LOT of Gjelina in Venice Beach. The tables are long and shared (I think they call them community tables?) but somehow not as awkward as other places I've been  with the same set up. We tried the duck sliders, calamari and fries. To be quite honest, I thought our selections were just ok. The flank steak and burger plates look promising, but I really hope the menu changes up more often than not! Otherwise, the drink selection is pretty great but this isn't really a place you can go just for drink: the bar fills up quick and there's not a lot of room to loiter!   Overall, this is a great date night place with good drinks and ok food. Make a reservation to avoid the awkward shuffling dance around the bar area if you have to wait.

WvnT758Eno1WEEeIzghshQ.review_text: Service was good, staff were friendly.  We ordered oysters and the pork loin and belly. Oysters were good. Pork loin was good but pork belly was dry and not tender enough.  I would still give this place another shot though!

lh0OMQQ6RNQ_zoAkBHsEdA.review_text: I've been looking forward to trying Maven for a long time.  Not many places in my area fit my style for nice places to go but Maven is superb.  Great atmosphere drinks and food, will be going there again very soon.

QocP49nZ7Fo-4Rp_QxPuDQ.review_text: I noticed shots are served in miniature glass cowboy boots, which seems to up the excitement and level of inebriation (placebo effect?). I really enjoyed the couches upstairs. The interior is dark and sleek, but still casual. The fries, dessert, and radish dish were meh.

N6rJPrW-iq4-bMCVdDEECw.review_text: Popped in with my boyfriend for a quick drink and was greeted and told to sit anywhere. We happened to pick a seat that was going to be reserved and to apologize for having us move literally 2 feet they offered a free appetizer or dessert. We happily relocated and said we didn't want anything because it was seriously no big deal. Was enjoying watching the chef make these mini sandwiches from our new seats and suddenly they were in front of me as a surprise - 2 duck sliders on the house.   The food was totally delicious and I plan to go back and have a full meal. The drink was well crafted and outstanding. The prices are extremely fair for what you are getting and every single staff member seemed genuinely sweet and on their game. Even the chef stopped what she was doing to ask how everything was tasting.  Shout out to the staff tonight - from someone who has done front facing jobs, you guys are killing it.

G8EQ4Kj5pSKLM5rqToMQLA.review_text: Any restaurant that doesn't take reservations and won't allow folks to add their names to a wait list-- is asking to be closed within a few months.  In this economy and with so many other great neighborhood joints-- I think the owners and their management staff need to change this policy ASAP!!!  Also-- who tells their potential customers that they can't wait inside the restaurant, at the bar, until a table is ready.  MAVEN-- PLEASE CHANGE THIS POLICY or expect to lose a ton of customers to your establishment-- SHAME ON YOU!!!!!!

7nNrdRd0VcEATAljrwafAw.review_text: Possibly my favorite brunch spot. I'm crazy about the duck hash. Bright, airy, great service, interesting food. I'm ravin' for Maven.

AHI4Ew--zYhs0m8npEd65g.review_text: A nice option for cocktails and dinner in Lower Haight, in a very un-Lower Haight environment. Maven is a great space, with modern decor, open dining room and bar seating where you can watch the chefs in action.  Recently just went for cocktails and they were delicious  Been there for dinner. Interesting menu concept, where each dish is paired with a brew or drink.

F5LhbsLPALA0B_yUBG2n9A.review_text: I had some time to kill and used my fab YELP app to find Maven, a brand new bar and restaurant on the lower Haight.  It was the perfect choice.    There is a bar, chefs counter, family style tables and couches upstairs.  The mood is very lounge, with lots of wood and a vertical garden over the bar. The curated menu of small plates and drinks compliment the low-key atmosphere, with a high-end expectation for quality food and original cocktails.   I ordered a Hometown Vixen, which was a mix of bourbon, pistachio, orange, lemon and gomme. (What's gomme?  Says bartender: A simple syrup with a silkier texture and far better for mixing in drinks).    The menu is divided by rows and columns. The recommended food and beverage pairings can be found along each row. Since I ordered the Hometown Vixen, I followed with a pairing of the Broccoli Agnolotti- ravioli styled pasta stuffed with broccoli, cipollini onions, tasso ham, broccoli crowns and mimolette cheese. Very delicious! For dessert I treated myself to the Honey Roasted Almonds with smoked sea salt and rosemary- a little unconventional, but my boyfriend is allergic to almonds so I have to indulge whenever I can!  A good place to go with a group of friends, after work cocktail, or kill time between Point A and B. I look forward to brunch "coming soon", but until then the Chinatown Duck Sliders and 5 Spot are calling my name.

QFt2Q2cB2No8YUtJeBQbpw.review_text: Been here for a few amazing dinners and just had the best breakfast today. The mix of flavors in each dish is uniquely their own yet true to the dish.  I've not been disappointed with any dish so just try them all.  The ambiance is not what you would expect for Haight street, in the best possible way.  Living wall above the bar, long redwood tables, concrete walls with huge windows give it a modern rustic feel that is inviting you to stay just a bit longer.  Which would bring my only complaint, sometimes you have to wait to get a seat.  But worth the wait you ask? You bet! I can't wait to explore the menu more while visiting some instant favorites again.

3E6SW9P9mvMYvj3gL51Brg.review_text: McFarland Springs Trout was amazing! I wasn't a huge fan of the Duck Sliders but my husband loved them.  We sat upstairs, great the atmosphere and decoration!

ghleBLzlSSQTb42A16CwaQ.review_text: The drinks are great and the food is pretty tasty as well. There are a few vegetarian options which makes me happy.

AGraTma9eEgsiJFDIy6tbg.review_text: We had a sweet online deal to get 4 tastings and 4 cocktails for two people.  I had never been to Maven so this was a perfect place for my friend and I to catch up and explore a new restaurant.    We tasted: * Autumn Chestnut Ravioli - golden apple, sage, maitake, sherry (nice, comforting, yummy taste, pasta was cooked perfectly, tender and chewy just right) *  Chinatown Duck Sliders - shiitake, chinese greens, bacon (this was our favorite, tangy yummy taste, tender, just right, loved) *  Local Albacore - eggplant, smoked creme fraíche, togarashi (pretty good, nice light, good taste, filling) *  Chocolate Mousse Napoleon - creme fraiche & lemon ice cream, malt, brandy (am not a big dessert person but this was a nice cap to our meal)  Accompanying cocktails: * Fireside Cocktail - rye, chestnut, apple, cinnamon, lemon, egg white (nice for Fall/Winter, nice and comforting apple spice taste, liked it a lot, went well with the Ravioli above) * 5 Spot - aged rhum, ginger, lime, maple, thai basil, five spice (pretty good, nice taste, like it a lot, went well with the Duck Sliders) * Chasing The Dragon - yamazaki 12yr, lemon, wu'long tea, rye, chartreuse (this was our favorite cocktail, it hit the spot, went perfectly with the Albacore above, I would order this cocktail again and again in the future) * Maven's Milk Punch - Maven's bourbon, rum, milk, hazelnut (sweet, nice accompanying cocktail with dessert, milky, comforting, nice)  Maven definitely knows their cocktails and they are YUM!  Food was very good with subtle Asian influnences and they go well with their cocktails (ask your waiter for recommendations).  We loved the Chinatown Duck Sliders and the cocktail Chasing the Dragon was a hit!  Really nice service and cute waiters I might add!  The communal tables are charming and there is also a nice bar and chef's counter too.  I would come back as it was a solid dining experience with great cocktails!

kZvBv_9JDhsWoUwCBQpZ6g.review_text: Let's start with the good stuff. The really good stuff. The drinks are great and the space is surprisingly well designed. Downstairs is communal dining and upstairs has a great view from the loft. It's hard to find a communal space that still feels intimate, but Maven pulls it off. It's a good restaurant and bar to bring a date, or go with friends, or even bring family.  The food: Burger and sprouts is pretty solid, but nothing to write hope about. Cheese plate is mediocre. The fries are okay, but the aioli is terrible. All and all, dinner here is consistently just o-k.   The drinks: great rotating selection and I always appreciate a menu that includes egg whites. As I have a little sweeter taste, I've found that most of their drinks suit my taste well.

hkEmdF3NXVS7H4CzSDlqkw.review_text: Maven feels like the slick, smart little brother of all the laid-back joints on this stretch of Haight Street. The one that got out of the 'hood, made it big, and is back for the family reunion. It's surrounded by raucous dive bars and tasty-yet-lacking-ambience holes-in-the-wall, but someone decided, we need a trendy cocktail bar here with a living wall.  And Maven fills that need.  We were only there for drinks, but the place was packed on a Wednesday evening. I lucked into two seats at the bar, but it was standing room only shortly after, so I highly recommend reservations. The Global Warming has been called out a number of times on Yelp for good reason, it's made with rye, pineapple and absinthe. My date had the 5-Stop and says that one's still her favorite.   If you don't feel like walking to Divis, Maven brings that vibe to you in Lower Haight. Check it out!

advkvQm4KiNtzOZGxUc2Xg.review_text: Yum!!!   Service - their hostess and bartender was super friendly and always there when you needed something.  Ambience - I love their interior design.It's definitely a place to hang out with friends - spacious and comfortable.  Food & Drinks - Order the duck slider, Autumn Chestnut Ravioli (Flavorful!) and their kobe burger! Delicious, but not overwhelming. And their drinks are good and strong!

JJ1vDNRwEA8exkN8AnHaEQ.review_text: UPDATE #2: Stopped in for a drink and a nibble on a Friday night. Good wine selection, tasty fries, and a friendly conversation with the owner. Happy to have a new bar in the 'hood. I just hope they can extend their license to stay open past midnight!  --------------------------------------------------­-----------  UPDATE #1:   I received a message from management that they've implemented a wait list, so I'm adding a star for the quick reply and responsiveness, and I'll be sure to go back soon to check out the new arrangement.  --------------------------------------------------­---------------  I was excited to try the new neighborhood place. 7:30 Friday night,  Christmas Eve eve, their 4th night open I think.  Us: "Table for 2 please?" Host: "We're actually full right now." Us: "OK, how long will the wait be." Host: "I don't actually know." Us: "OK, well can we put our names on the list?" Host: "We don't actually keep a list. No reservations and no list." Us: "Hmmm, I understand not taking rezzies, but no list? Really? OK, well can we get a drink at the bar while we wait." Host: "Um, no, we actually can't have you wait inside the restaurant."  OK, so now we basically have 2 options. 1) Wait outside the restaurant and check back every 30 seconds to see if a table is ready, or 2) go somewhere else.  We really wanted to try it out, but were totally put off by the service. So, we opted for a decent meal a few doors down.   Either the owners have no idea how to run a restaurant or the host has no idea how to work the door, or both. I'll stop by again in a month or so when they've had a chance to work out the kinks, but I certainly hope they figure out a better seating arrangement!

fa93mqv_SSagBq_gTLB5NA.review_text: Showed up on a Sunday night on a whim and really liked this place.  Cocktails are good and creative, they have a nice wine and beer list, and their small plates are all tasty.  They place only has communal tables, or your can sit at the chef's bar or the main bar.  We chatted with the chefs and munched on 5 dishes between the two of us.  Between the wine and cocktails the tab came to $100 but that's pretty much the norm these days for going out in SF.  A really nice addition to the lower Haight.

yO7AgteqEpkxkV9BCz59Sw.review_text: I came for brunch with a friend and I was immediately taken by how beautiful the space is. It's a very open concept with long communal tables, bar seating, an open kitchen. Very clean, and rustically modern.  We opted to sit at the bar since it was just the two of us. The drinks here were great. I was severely hung over so the Bloody Mary really brought me back to life. This was a great bloody because it was more flavorful and spicy than just pure booze or tomato juice. The balsamic vinegar and basil were great additions and the pickled vegetables that came with it were so delicious that I had to ask for more.  Everything on the menu looked great and I was deciding between the Duck Hash or the Breakfast Banh Mi. I decided to be more adventurous and choose the banh mi because I had never had a breakfast version. My friend got the flatbread with a lot of seasonal vegetables on it. Both our dishes were humongous. You know it's big when it can barely fit on the plate. The banh mi had a lot of potential but I think the sum of the components just didn't work together. The bread used was quite soft and one of the most important parts about a banh mi is the integrity of the bread. This along with the oozing fried egg made it impossible to really pick up and eat without making a huge mess and falling apart so I ended up just knife and forking it and eating the interior. It was also noticeably missing a spice component. I noticed there weren't sliced jalapenos included, which is fine for this version but it definitely needed some spice factor so I asked for hot sauce. I wouldn't order it again unless they make some changes but the idea is still a good one.

A4Q7hjE6koay5EftZ1FkBw.review_text: They have some great little things to eat here while you are drinking. Chinatown duck sliders are great with cocktails and the brussel sprouts are just good,  period.   This is really a place to go for cocktails,  though. You can tell the bartenders are total mixology nerds and that's great. Just don't get caught up in a discussion about alembic stills or small batch bourbon though, because you might never get out of there.   All the drinks I've had here have been great. Unfortunately I don't remember the names of any of them!

b5o1pa4YTDeqYChqzJ2VCw.review_text: Awesome. Awesome. Had the duck sliders $9  and the Nauti' mermaid $10. If you're hungry they won't completely fill you up but they are tasty as can be.  Service is awesome and the staff that work here are so down to earth and friendly. Definitely a stop by.

awmRirDC7WWig6R07XZ_oA.review_text: a perfect place for ladies to meet up...no reservations, all communal tables, fancy ice cubes and cocktails, the whole menu is set up for pairing - read entries horizontally for connection.   loved: burger, calamari, oysters, trout, fries, peach/nectarine salad.

lXiYA2IH1YfUtqymMuKu2Q.review_text: Yummmm yummm and great vibe. Ck it out in the lower height!!!

p3xozp6pJdFismZH7eh6RA.review_text: Maven ooooohhhh Maven.... You are way too close to my sister's new place, and thus, we spend way too much money here. You don't know this, but you've become the unofficial "upstairs" to her apartment.  The cocktails are exquisite, and the bartenders are never pretentious which is so refreshing for such artistry.

CEDTvkhif2wMwsYhaHWEMQ.review_text: Maven was awesome. It was a trendy place I found on Yelp and Google. Medium sized on the corner of Haight St. Great decor and atmosphere.   We were celebrating a belated valentines day dinner so weren't too worried about the budget, which could get easily stretched here if not kept under control. I had 3 pints of North Coast and Pam tried various wines.   We started with the Chinatown duck sliders and Penn Cove mussels. Both were FANTASTIC. Unbelievable. Portions were appetizer sized as advertised but not a huge deal - the taste made up for it. Can't tell you how good these were.   The customer service was phenomenal - our host also waited on us and couldn't have been friendlier. Hip young staff and they all seemed to genuinely enjoy what they were doing.   Strongly recommended for a taste of local San Francisco cuisine and not that touristy bullshit most people decide to do.

pstUj_8tgwbF0AktTUJasw.review_text: I agree w/reviewer Sonny-Drinks are pricey and the pours bordering on cheap...I mean if you are going to charge me 10 bucks plus for a glass of wine then at least make it beyond half way in the glass....and the cocktails are in small glasses,the Martini was a mini.I thought the Apps were good except the burger which was more bun than burger.

notPJ9iEf1aw_wuu_4fsdg.review_text: When you enter Maven, it really seems like the younger sibling of NOPA -- the decor, the atmosphere, the crowd. It's much smaller and seems much artsier (the artistic red lamps, the upright garden directly above the bar) than NOPA, but lacks a bit of the welcoming vibe that NOPA has. This could just be because Maven is the new kid on the block and really needs some time to adjust into its own, but I definitely felt that it was trying a little too hard to impress.  Our server, Jordan, was awesome. Very relaxed, personable, and not at all pushy. We did have one random female server come and just grab our plate (which still had about 4 or 5 fries on it), before we were finished. Even if there was nothing on the plate, it's only courteous for the server to ask if we're finished before she grabs it away. Didn't like that at all. But Jordan was great.  -----------------------------  FOOD:  Savory Winter Tart = Delicious. The combination of the flaky pastry crust, the ricotta cheese, and the mushrooms was perfect. It was oily, for sure, but not so much that you were overwhelmed.   Chinatown Duck Slider = Excellent. The duck was extremely tender and the flavors meshed together very well. The bread was a buttery brioche that complemented the duck incredibly.  Broccoli Angolotti = I wasn't a fan of this dish at all. The pasta was very tough and firm, and I couldn't really taste the broccoli. It was actually quite frankly very tasteless and underwhelming.  Maven Burger = This burger was okay. I've definitely had much better burgers in SF that have packed much more flavor. We ordered the burger medium-rare, but it came closer to medium-well. There was a faint pink in the center, but the burger was way too overcooked. I think the burger would go better with a more tangy sauce or even a fried egg to give it some more flavor.  Kennebec Fries w/ Olive Aioli = Excellent fries. Hot and crispy, with a faint but quite-addicting aioli sauce.  DRINKS:  Global Warming = Sweet and satisfying. A great sipping drink.  5 Spot = Tangy and spicy. I liked it a lot.  Three Little Birds = Decent drink. Doesn't really pack much flavor.  Hibiki Highball = It was okay. I love whiskey, but for some reason the combination of this drink was a bit tough to swallow.  Grand Total = $115.00 (including tax & tip) -----------------------------  Maven is a good addition to the Lower Haight, but didn't blow my mind upon first visit. The food had its ups and downs and the drinks were good for the most part. I'm sure as Maven evolves, it'll start coming into its own and stand out as the place to be in the Lower Haight area. As for now, however, it still has a long way to go.

DDrwHxw2XGdtjYj9ISAbAA.review_text: The food is awesome.  I went there for brunch, had the Duck Hash, Billionaire Bacon & a Maven Bloody.  The billionaire bacon is cooked in brown sugar.  The Maven Bloody has a unique mint taste to it.  All of it was delicious.  Getting a seat can be difficult because so many people want to go here.  Some hipsters with bad haircuts just about stole our seats then the hostess stepped in to fix it.  The hipsters with hair that looks like they just got out of bed were everywhere.  It was like a hipster bed head apocalypse.  I need to open up a hipster salon.  I'll use tools from the 15th century that do a really bad job of cutting hair.  Then I'll charge outrageous fees to convince hipsters it's worth it.  Anyways...go here for the great food and hipsters with sh*tty haircuts.

CZ36wJqV-Xit758UaOr81A.review_text: Maven is a trendy little spot located in Lower Haight, nestled on the corner of Steiner and Fillmore. They serve up awesome small plates/tapas so this place is ideal for sharing. It's also filled with communal tables so expect to sit next to strangers while you dine here, however, don't be discouraged. They do a good job of spacing the chairs/stools.   CRISPY BRUSSELS SPROUTS ~ 4.5 stars ~ $6: Brussels have been something I've grown to love more and more with age. I enjoy them most roasted - crispy shell, tender interior and some bitterness. Maven does an amazing job adding flavor to their Brussels preparing it with an apple gastrique. The caramelization of the sugar deglazed with balsamic vinegar gives it good bite to compliment the natural bitterness.   KENNEBEC FRIES ~ 4 stars ~ $6: Seasoned with juniper salt and served with housemade olive aioli. Great crunch, nice flavor. It's a great compliment to whatever you're having with it, however, I'd pass on these. $6 for a small serving of fries is a little steep.   HOUSEMADE PICKLES ~ 4 stars ~ $7: Pickled fennel, beets, cucumbers, cauliflower and carrots served up in a mason jar. Not too vinegary with excellent flavor. Textures were all on-point especially the cauliflower. FYI, I'm a cauliwhore.   MAVEN'S BURGER ~ 5 stars ~ $12: People often lose sight of what makes a good burger. It really comes down to two things: The patty and the bun. You can throw all kinds of unique and exotic toppings and sauces on your burger but if you don't nail down the patty and misfire on the bun, everything will go downhill. Maven delivers a medium-rare patty seasoned to perfection with the help of angostura bitters. The awesome and heavenly juices flowing out of the patty after each bite is sopped up by their awesome dense but flaky bun. You get a bit of crunch and bite with the house pickles and the melted muenster holds everything together. Served with a small side of ridiculously delicious house made potato chips, this burger is fit for a king. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS.   I went with two of my buddies. Each of us ordered two beers and a cocktail. We each had a burger and shared the rest of the small plates. Pricing was awesome. We split the bill three ways and we each paid $47.06 pre-tip. I was shocked by how much of a bargain dinner was, especially when you consider how A-W-E-S-O-M-E the burger is. Service was also top-notch and the cocktails were excellent. I don't have ANYTHING negative to say about Maven. The whole dining experience was great and I would absolutely go back.

LWqUUT_4ubD8oED5S3haQg.review_text: I visited Maven after reading a lot of the reviews on-line and also the Yelp reviews.   I would have to say that my experience there was wonderful, we were greeted by a wonderful hostess (Jamie) who took our name down for a table for 2.   (Seems like Maven has taken care of the list problem after their first couple of weeks opening)  We were seated very quickly and even got a Chef's table seating, which we immensely enjoyed watching the chefs cook each meal. I would highly recommended this if you like to watch chefs cook!  They were so attentive on the food preparation that they taste tested each meal and in one case the head chef re-plated the dish because the preparation was not up to par.  Our wait staff was attentive and our food came out quickly, especially since we could see it getting made. The food was hot and tasty and even though the place was pretty crowded we did not wait long for our first course.   We had the following..   Duck Sliders - These were awesome, moist and flavorful! Warm Olives - love olives, and now even better when warm! Seared Arctic Char - Wonderful light fish and the sauce was wonderful Skirt Steak - Moist, and cooked Medium with a wonderful maple sauce, the Yams were a nice addition to add some sweetness.  Lastly we spoke with one of the Owners during our meal and he asked what we would like to dessert. We told him to surprise us and he brought out the Cheese Plate with honey which was just amazing to finish off the meal along with the pairing drink (Widow's Kiss). A subtle sweetness to a fulfilling meal.  Overall the wait staff is attentive, the food was just right, and the drinks were just great.  P.S. Try the Three little birds and the Global Warming drinks.. wonderful!
